description:
From a Golden State Warriors fan's perspective, I like the name of the taqueria, "The City". 

The configuration of this taqueria is very unique. It is not big from the outside and very narrow inside, but it is long with surprisingly a good amount of seating and dining area.

From the newly-installed digital menu, the prices are just as competitive as anywhere else. I ordered the Grilled steak super burrito for $10.00, which is the average price. You place your order through the chefs in the very back, who cooks and grill your meat and tortillas right in front of you. Basically, you know and visualize your meat are cooked fresh.  All the other condiments are colorful and separated in another part of the kitchen. You have to like that for freshness.

The chef knows how to grilled the meat to perfection. The steak was very flavorful without being overly-burnt. The super burrito has a perfect amount of the condiments. The melted cheese was very sharp. Sour cream was not excessive. The guacamole was green. And the hot salsa was a nasal-opener. 

I don't go to that part of Divisadero Street often. But the burrito is just as good as any. And yes, I also liked the name. I am a big fan.
author: Matt G.

description:
The food was okay the service was awful. The guy was rude with me because I was taking to long to order. He even told me that if I did not like what I was seeing I should go to the taqueria next door. 

In terms of the food everything was just okay. The pico the gallo was missing some flavor.
author: Margarita T.

description:
Had a great experience here!
While I'm typically inclined to go to another nearby Mexican joint, I wanted to try something different.

I got a taco salad and enjoyed it. I loved how they fried the shell right in front of me. It's all very fresh and made to order. My friend really liked his burrito.

I would definitely come here again. Staff was nice and food was reasonably priced.
author: Emma B.

description: Only recommendation is need better vegetarian options but that's the same things for most places. This hot spot need to be talked about more in the Bay Area! Fresh Fresh to death! They cook meats to order!
author: Tippy T.

description: I just arrived to SF from SD and this place is by far the closest to real Mexican food. I had the carne asada and al pastor torta and it was a perfect combo.
author: Dante D.

description:
The chef takes your order and you can watch him prepare your dish.

I ordered carnitas super burrito, no beans. The lettuce and tomatoes were surprisingly super fresh. That was nice. However, the carnitas were soggy, and had no crispiness. I was able to finish my entire burrito and usually I have trouble everywhere else to do that because their burritos are too big. This was a first.

I'm not sure if I would come back. There wasn't anything that stood out to me.
author: Lynn C.

description: Good veggie burrito! The peppers and onions were a nice touch and the spicy burrito is really quite spicy!
author: Shruti D.

description:
This afternoon, when I found myself with a rumbling stomach - in Lower Pacific Heights/Upper Fillmore - far, far away from my usual stomping grounds, where great taquerias abound, I had no idea who to turn to. And, honestly, I walked into The City Taqueria with pretty low expectations. 

While it's not the best taqueria fare you'll find in SF, and the prices are more than I normally pay in the Mission, if you're in the area looking for a cheap bite to eat ... I highly recommend The City Taqueria. At least half of the ingredients on my veggie taco were made to order. That's to say, the veggies were thrown on the 'parilla' and grilled while I waited. Mmmm, tasty!

Don't let the bizarre layout or south-of-the-frontera vibe turn you off. Check it out for yourself!
author: Beau W.

description:
How this place has less than four stars is a travesty. It's the big three of good, fast, and cheap. And truly goes for the grand slam when you add in how big the portions are.

I have never been disappointed here and neither has my wife. She had the fish taco bowl which was amazing and massive. I had a regular beef burrito which is large.

For the super hungry, if you get the super size it is two burritos connected to one another. I almost finished one once but the grease was too much when I got to the bottom. If I were to attempt it again, I'd probably cut the thing in half or let grease and other liquids drain out.

Wow it's good though, totally recommend this place. They talk to my Spanish speaking white wife "en espanol" and don't make fun of me for being a "gringo" or my poor Spanish accent. 

If you are looking for a douchey SF decor place, don't come here.
author: David A.

description: Needed a quick burrito fix, my usual spot wasn't open so came over here. Food had the right amount of grease, staff was super friendly and helpful, vibe of the place was super low key. Really enjoyed it. Wish the meat had more flavor. Overall good place to get burrito craving fix.
author: Kafilat Y.

description: WTF what's the point of ordering by phone if when you get there the idiot cashier doesn't charge you until is your turn on the busy line  , I got soooo mad that didn't even get my food and took off thanks for that guy no lunch for me,
author: Luis O.

description:
There is no taqueria better! The food is fantastic! I live off of this food. The grilled chicken is bomb,
So flavorful. I literally eat here very week. I used to live close but now I don't but I still travel 45 minutes and cross a bridge just to get it! There is no taqueria better. Ingredients are fresh and flavorful.
Eduardito is the weekday chef, hes knows exactly what I like!! Love you guys!!!
author: Nakia C.

description:
Absolutely love this place. Fresh ingredients, meat is grilled right in front of you after you order and the  result is just so delicious. Portions are big and prices are pretty good for the quality. Personal favorite is the shrimp taco salad. Shrimp cooked just right with onions and bell peppers before they carefully assemble you salad in a tortilla bowl that just came out of the fryer. Definitely best Mexican food place in the area. They do take a while preparing your food, but at least you're not getting stale meat that has been sitting there for hours.

Last but not least the personnel is really nice and carefully craft your meal with a smile.
author: Monica P.

description:
Oh Ocean Taqueria... (this place has gone through a few names, but it's the same OG dudes running the grill)

I am an avid burrito eater, have lived in SF for 10 years, and i put this as one of the top burritos (ON MOST Days).
Why? they make your burrito meat [carne asada or pollo asada] fresh on the grill everytime 
They have tasty refried beans and spanish rice. 

...
That aside, some pro tips from someone who has probably gotten 500+ burritos over the last 10 years across this location and the Ocean St one over in Ingleside (same set-up, order at the grill then build your burrito BUT IT IS NOW CLOSED):

Tips:
*Add onions and/or peppers before they throw it on the grill
*Add fresh avocado vs their guac (guac is tasty but it's "watered down" w sour cream), it is an option.

*Ask for the "Lady Gaga" Salsa.. it's the red one that isn't used in the burrito, really garlic-y
author: Naveed B.

description: This place is a little hidden gem. The hallway is long and narrow and there is not many tables but don't let that stop you! The chef was preparing the food right in front of us and the flavors were amazing. I got the spicy shrimp and for the price it was a huge portion. Spicy means spicy though- sometime that's not the case, but they really delivered on the spiciness. They have frozen Mexican ice cream which the kids loved after dinner.
author: Francine B.

description:
Bomb AF 

Don't know how long my review needs to be so that Yelp doesn't flag it as a tip but the above is all that you need to know.
author: Kyle M.

description: Best Mexican spot around. Tastes greaaaaat and the portions are very generous. I always come here for lunch. Make sure to get there around 11am before the crowd arrives or else you'll be waiting forever!
author: wendy h.

description: Food was tasty and I love that they cook the asada to order.  The negatives are they charge for chips and salsa and they're really not that cheap.  I'll go back for a change of pace on occasion.
author: Bryan G.

description: I love this place. I started going to its original location ocean taq in crab ave as a teenager and its been my go to burrito . I love the freshness of the meat and the vegetables. I know the guys in the shop and they always know my order. Love this place
author: Aisling O.

description:
We came here for brunch/lunch last Sunday after a big night out in SF since the "better spot" (according to my friend we stayed with) is unfortunately closed on Sundays. The burritos were alright but nothing amazing. I had a veggie burrito and wish that...

- They'd asked me what type of tortilla I wanted. I saw others with whole wheat tortillas, etc. but they automatically put mine in flour.
- They had a salsa bar. I love salsa bars at Mexican restaurants and was surprised they didn't have one!
- Had tables for 4 people. All but one table seemed to be just for 2 people (we still pulled up a third chair to one but it wasn't ideal).
- They had better avocado and/or guacamole!

That said, the burrito was big and the staff were nice. Also, they are conveniently close to the Fishbowl!
author: Meghan P.

description: I gave them a two star because my order was ready when I got there 5 mins after calling in. Every one was nice. I ordered a supper burrito with carnitas. There was no flavor at all. I received two types of sauce. Red and green. The red had a kick after the first try. After that it tasted like it was watered down. I wouldn't go back or recommend it to anyone. I love Mexican food however I was a bit disappointed. No taste in the meat and watered down hot sauce. Also it did not come with any chips or salsa.
author: Nino A.

description:
Long before it was The City Taqueria, I was dining at Ocean Taqueria on a weekly basis and it was my favorite burrito north of market street. It had been a while since I had been inside so I figured I'd see what this name change was all about. Let's put it this way, nothing has changed. Thank the heavens above. 

It's still the same fresh burrito I remember from days past and glad to see they haven't compromised any quality. Btw, I always opt for the pollo verde super burrito, but the grilled chicken & carne asada are legit too. There is something about chicken that has been chilling in a warm salsa verde all day that makes it extremely juicy and awesome and there's nothing else like it. They warm your tortilla right in front of you, so always opt for melting the cheese. 

If you're feeling ballsy you can get the jumbo burrito (which is the size of a small child). I've attempted to eat this monster twice in my life and failed both times. Arg. Anyway, if you're looking for something quick, delicious and affordable, this is your jam. 

Gracias Amigos.
author: Benjamin F.

description: Super fresh, meat cooked to order.  They keep asking if you want stuff in your burrito, to make sure you get it just the way you want it.  My most favorite burrito in the City!
author: Pul F.

description: The burrito was soooooooooo bomb. I got the pollo and my boyfriend got the carnitas. The carnitas is super crispy which is the way we like it and the pollo was super bomb too. They even cook the meat first then put it on the burrito so it's freshly cooked. The cool and employees are very friendly. Definitely will be coming back!
author: Brianna G.

description:
This place is passable when El Burrito Express down the street is closed. Based on Yelp recommendations, I got the carne asada burrito, which was pretty good. I like that they grill the tortillas a little before making the burritos, and the fillings and prices are right, but things just feel a little rushed and not necessarily put together with a lot of care.

All-in-all, it's fine, but not awesome. Definitely recommend EBX as a better alternative. I snapped some photos of the menus since they're unavailable otherwise online. Hope that helps someone out.
author: Andrew M.

description:
5 stars for the super veggie burrito with extra cilantro, refried beans and salsa picante.

I had a hard time finding the listing on yelp as I was looking it up under the name "City Taqueria," which is the name displayed on their sign. 

This place is a hole in the wall - you could stretch out your arms and nearly reach wall to wall. It is quite long though - so it really feels like the place is just one long hallway.

I was a little trepidatious, the hand written sign and humble decor didn't inspire confidence, then again, some of the best food is found in the most meager surroundings. And yippee that turned out to be the case. 

The tortilla was grilled to toasty perfection, the beans were creamy and savory, the toppings were fresh and delicious. This has got to be one of the best super veggie burritos in town.
author: Carole B.

description: I've given City Taqueria a 3 previously for their quesadilla (my usual at a Mexican restaurant because even when I try to get something different, the cheesy meaty vortex of a good quesadilla always drags me back in). I definitely like nearby Burrito Express' quesadilla much more. But today on a whim I tried the combination plate (choice of meat; I got shrimp and fish) and it was fantastic. For $12.99 they load your plate up with hearty servings of rice, choice of beans, lettuce, pico, guacamole, salsa, sour cream, cilantro, peppers, and 4 corn or flour tortillas. The meat/fish had a great grill going for it. I definitely recommend the plates here which was really hit the spot for me today. The staff is great as well. Then afterwards, grab a drink at one of the nearby bars on Divisadero.
author: Will H.

description:
Really good carne asada and carnitas. Burrito is made rightnin front of you, and you have the option to get sautéed onions and peppers with your burrito. 

Outside of the mission spots, this is one of the best burritos around.
author: Jon F.

description: This is a great hole in the wall authentic burrito spot in San Francisco. The guys here are awesome and the food is always incredible!
author: Katie W.

description: I stumbled upon this place when I moved in to the neighborhood. Since then, I have gone there countless time. There fresh and high quality food keeps me coming back. Their fish is delicious and so is the chicken burrito. You can't go wrong. If you like spicy, be sure to ask for sliced jalapeños and their habanero salsa!
author: Hannah L.

description: July 20, 2016: another price increase, a big one, not such a great value anymore.
author: John N.

description:
This used to be Ocean Taqueria! I used to come here a few times a month before moving to a different part of the city. This place is the reason I still visit lower pac heights from time to time. 

Their super burrito is tasty. My personal favorite is their carnitas. Asked them to put in on the grill for a few minutes. I guarantee you'll like it!
author: See Yew M.

description: A bit of a wait but well worth it.  The super shrimp burrito - YUMMY!  Our work group typically goes to El Burrito Express a few stores down but it is closed for renovation.  I think we have a new to-go for our monthly burrito cravings.
author: Frances H.

description: Enjoyed this place.  Portions were large and very tasty.  I had a shrimp and chicken tacos.  Super friendly service is a plus.
author: Shawn C.

description:
This is my go-to burrito spot. I grew up in San Francisco, and otherwise need to drive to the Mission to get my perfect burrito. 

Yes, this place is a hole-in-the-wall. It doesn't offer trendy industrial or rustically chic decor, but the food is great and that's all I'm looking for. 

One of my favorite thing's about City is that they offer 'baby' sized burritos that they treat like regular sized burritos. This means I can get all of my favorite toppings in proportion, without pretending I'm ordering for my 11 year old cousin, or wasting a drop of the delicious green salsa. I also love the grilled onions/peppers you can get in the steak burrito - yum!

On top of the great food, the guys that run this place are awesome. They're super nice and friendly, and they really care about putting out good food.
author: Natalie T.

description: Came home to visit my mother and wanted a good burrito. Found this location on Yelp and decided to give it a try. You can almost miss this place because it's tucked a small spot. The employees were nice and helpful in figuring out what I wanted. The burrito was a nice size and the food was fresh. Liked that the carne asada was cooked to order. It was a very good burrito and will definitely go back when I return during the holidays.
author: Monica M.

description:
I was in the area and stopped at this location for a regular chicken burrito. The guy overcharged me $2 and when questioned he said the extra $2 was for sour cream and guacamole. The menu on the wall says $8.95 with everything on it. 
2 more customers complained the about same thing. Food quality was average and doesn't come with chips and salsa. This place is a ripoff , stay from here and be careful about what you pay!
author: Axl r.

description: Meat was fresh to order. Salsa is not overly salty. Solid burritos. Going to be coming here more often.
author: Edward K.

description:
"LEGIT"

Delicious and filling. One should never eat food made by an angry person, and the cooks here always seem so mellow and happy!

Enjoy the sports games blaring from the t.v. while you wait for your carryout order or sit at a quiet table near the cheery front window. No one will bother you.
author: Evangeline W.

description: If you're okay with mild food poisoning, this is the place for you! I only have gone here when El Burrito is closed and I'm desperate. I have sadly regretted it every time. I've brought guests here and it made them physically sick. The interior is claustrophobic. I wouldn't recommend it.
author: Katelyn C.

description: Easily one of the best taquerias around- same as the old ocean taqueria just under new ownership. Carne Asada tacos and ask for habenero salsa and sliced avacodos
author: William J.

description: This is THE spot for veggie burritos. The dudes make it exactly how you want it, and listen to everything you say. You can ask for extra or light of anything and they will gladly do it without charging. Looks like a janky place but it's too good to pass up!
author: Pallavi S.

description: Good food and nice folks and affordable pricing. If you're going during the lunch hour, go early.
author: jason k.

description: One of the closest burrito joints to my place around here, and a little pricer than El Burrito and a bit smaller in size. Opened late, but decent burritos. Usually order the carne asada super burrito since their regular ones are too small and it doesn't come with complimentary chips like El Burrito.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Great spot. Very authentic. I SAW they had whole tortillas SO I ASKED for one. THEY DO offer SALSA TO TRY, but no need for a bar. Place is small but FINE. I came with 3 other people and OH NO we had to sit at separate tables that were 5 FEET from each other. Since I'm an ADULT I was able to cope with the fact that the other ppl in my party were not sitting in my lap. If I were this place I'd prevent the SNOBS that give them less than 5 stars from eating there. Get over it, you pretentious morons! 

Keep on keeping on city taqueria!! Best burritos in SF!!
author: Emily S.

description:
Who doesn't LOVE BURRITOS! ?!?!?

If you don't, then you are truly not a San Franciscan!!! San Francisco is known for our burritos. The are second to best to real Mexican AUTHENTIC food. Now there are many different types of burritos from; tradition Mexican, sushi burritos, candy burritos, ramen burritos, nann burritos, and the list goes on. 

However there is one place in particular that has the best burritos ever! Hands down, there are no comparison. Ocean Taqueria, which changed their name most recently to The City Taqueria. Is located on Divisadero. I had very easy access to this dive, because I went to school about 4 blocks away!

When you first walk in, you kind of have a sketchy feeling, because you have to walk all the way in the back of the restaurant to order. You can get burritos, tacos, enchiladas, nachos, tostada, quesadillas, or their plates. You get to choose what meat you want, what kind of tortilla, and whatever else you want in it. The staff their are VERY FRIENDLY. I really like going there because they do make you feel welcomed. 

Every time I go to The City Taqueria, I always order a Carne Chile Verde burrito. I ask for a spinach tortilla (because I always think it's somewhat healthier in my mind, when probably there isn't a huge difference) and add lettuce, Chile Verde, sour cream, cheese, and rice. I would have asked for guacamole but, I'm allergic to avocados (what a stupid allergy). Their carne is so well cooked that the meat is so flaky and its the kind where you don't need a knife to pull it apart. It just kind of crumbles on its one. 

Part of why I like The City Taqueria so much, is that it holds memories for me, being able to go after school or during lunch with my friends, and then sitting down eating our burritos and talking, was something I cherish doing with my friends. Note: When I usually go I also tip them because this is actually the second one, but the first one closed down, and I don't want this one to go either!

Check out my profile to find my official blogs as well as more food reviews
author: Food G.

description: one of best taqueria, outside of the mission district. enjoy their taco salad and burritos; you can choose from five to six hot sauces. service is courteous and friendly.
author: Albert E.

description:
You know that feeling of having eaten something so satisfying that you can't stop thinking about it, imagining how soon it will be until you can eat it again?  Today, hiking in the hills a bridge away from the City, I began fantasizing about City tasks that must be done soon simply to bring me back in range of this carne asada:  Puppy and kitten viewing in Macy's window, ice skating at the Embarcadero, martini at the Fairmont.  Did you see Christmas shopping on that list?  Yeah, me neither.  

Anyhow, last week somebody brought me a regular carne asada burrito from Ocean.  I'd read that the carne asada here is cooked to order and I'm here to report that they have hit upon something magical.  The carne asada in my regular burrito was a splendid thing.  Individual crunchy pieces, not a speck of gristle, then the happy ending:  Soup-like meat juices settle into the burrito base, drip down your hand as you try to eat, plop on your paper plate and are there to be blotted up with remaining tortilla bits.  Not all carne asada burritos end this way but the best of them do.  

My burrito included pinto beans, fajita veggies, pico de gallo, hot salsa, and rice.  Not coincidentally, the exact same burrito I'll be getting on my next visit, when I come in to see the puppies.
author: Tracey A.

description: My boyfriend is a taco freak and he loves trying out great tacos.  The City Taqueria is right around the corner from where I live and it's one of his favorite places to go that's convenient when he doesn't feel like driving to the Mission.  Staff is always always friendly and happy and eager to make their customers happy and the price is definitely right for an easy quick dinner without a lot of fuss.  Terrific job!
author: Lynn A.

description: I just paid under $13 for a mediocre veggie burrito from this place. So it had (a splash of) guac and sour cream, is that why it costed me so much? Or was it the bland chips that tasted like they were made the day before and the tiny taste of salsa verde that accompanied them? I don't know. I just don't think the burrito I just ate was worth what I paid. El Burrito express 4life yo. Next time I want a burrito on a Sunday (when el burrito is closed) I will just go to Panchos on Geary.
author: Winni D.

description:
Normally I like this place, and order from them regularly.  Well, not after tonight!  

I called around 6:15 to place an order of 2 burritos and some enchiladas.  The guy on the phone took my order, but mentioned they were busy tonight.  No worries, I asked how much longer it would be then.  It's normally only 10-15 min.  I said, "20 min"  he said, probably not.  I said" 30 min", he said "that better, yes, see you then."  I showed up about 45 min later and gave my name, but it turns out they hadn't even started my order!  When I showed surprise, he pointed to the line and said, they were "very busy" and that I could "get in line."

WHOA.  First of all, there were 5 people in line, I was #6.  There were 2 tables of 2 eating in the otherwise empty restaurant.  So, we're talking 4 people sitting down and eating, and 5 people ordering.  If that is "too busy" and you can't handle serving that "many" people, what are you doing in the restaurant business?  And he wasn't even nice or apologetic about not putting in my order, he just waived me away and told me to wait in line.

Sorry Ocean, you may only be 2 blocks from me, but I'll be driving to El Tonayense from now on.  Their food is better anyway, but the convenience made up for it.  Not anymore.  Crappy service is the worst offense for me, personally.  Bye bye.
author: Jennifer F.

description: I've given this place a few tries and it always comes up lacking. The meaty quesadilla seemed to always turn into a watery mess. I'm all for a wet burrito or sauce quesadilla but this was a mess. I wanted to like this place but probably won't go back.
author: William L.

description: This is definitely my favorite to-go restaurant in Lower Pacific Heights. It has amazing food for fairly low prices (and many great options for vegetarians!). I love the nice community feel of the place, and the service is absolutely wonderful. I go to school a few blocks away from this place, and I end up eating lunch here several times a week. I certainly recommend!
author: Stewart J.

description:
We got takeout from here tonight and this was the worst burrito I have ever had. The burrito was limp and loosely packed with flavorless ingredients. It had wilted lettuce and took me 4 or 5 bites to get to the chewy awful meat.

The burritos here used to be delicious! They must of changed owners. I miss the old ocean taqueria
author: Emily N.

description: I absolutely love City Taq. The two guys who work here could not be nicer. The burrito is made to order in front of you and is incredible every time. I prefer the burritos here to EBX.
author: Caroline R.

description:
OK.. so i actually ave been here a long time ago but came out after 15 min because i didnt know where those lines were and didnt know how to order.

after i asked my coworkers, i finally had the courage to go back and this will be my 3rd time to order from here:

REALLY good mexican food!! BURRITOS YESSS... mission district style... They make your food as you order customer by customer and they comply with your little simple requests.. The staff is also nice!

carna asada regular burrito is yummy...
carnitas regular burrito is delicous... 
chicken tacos are heaven...

they make your food accordingly, and you dont end up with a BLOB of MESS like you do sometimes at other places.. 

did i mention, YUMMY?
author: Steve S.

description: I've been coming to City Taqueria for over 10 years (my friends and I still refer to it as Ocean Taq), and this is my favorite taqueria in the city. The atmosphere is not fancy or hip, but they make amazing food. Unlike most other taquerias in the city that pre-cook meat before you order, the guys at City Taqueria cook the meat right in front of you after you order it. They do the same with peppers/onions which I highly recommend putting on your burrito. The Carne Asade is tremendous.
author: David S.

description:
After bouncing back and forth between El Burrito Xpress three doors down and this place, I finally decided that this was my go-to spot. And after seeing that people trash this place over on EBX's page, I felt like I had to come to Ocean Taq's defense.

For one, Ocean Taq is open on Sundays (EBX is not). That's huge after a big Saturday night.

More importantly, I love how this place is endearingly divey. It is laid out totally wrong, but that just shows you that the owners may not know restaurant pyschology - but they know burritos. You order all the way in the back, past the whole seating area, where you can no longer even see the menu; but you know exactly what you are getting because it's made like two feet in front of you.

They grill or fry up everything fresh, even their own chips. I've had the carnitas and pollo asado and both were tasty. The meat is done on a flat top grill and they throw in onions and peppers if you like. One time I was craving a breakfast burrito so I asked if they had eggs. Sure they did! They whipped em up right there and threw it on the flat top. The staff are super nice and I feel like half the time they just throw in chips for free.
author: Cody R.

description:
Look, I'm all about grody taquerias in Pac Heights, even ones with misfitting names (why "Ocean Taqueria," exactly?).  If it offends the nouveau riche, I'm all for it.  In plenty of shapes and sizes, and especially colors.  Yes, my friends, if the rich white people prancing around are even the slightest bit annoyed by something because of its lack of class or the non-rich-white people it attracts to the rich white people's neighborhood, count me as a fan.  Except Ocean Taqueria does it all wrong.

Located not too far from Ocean Taqueria, my friends at El Burrito Express 2 serve up some of the best burritos this side of the Mission District, and they do it in a dank, dark, humid taqueria that's singularly unpleasant to visit but for all the right reasons.

Ocean Taqueria isn't quite dark, not really, and its dining area is actually pretty impressive; but the food's bad.  It's not disgusting, but it's not good either, and I paid way too much for a super veggie burrito even though I got to choose exactly what I wanted.  See, if I can choose all my ingredients and the burrito's still bad, then the ingredients are bad, and if the ingredients are bad, well, we've got a problem.

So that additional star is for annoying the rich white people.  Keep doing your thing, Ocean Taqueria, but don't expect me to visit you anymore.  El Burrito Express calls, ridiculous lack of lighting and ventilation and all.
author: John S.

description:
What's the quickest way to a food coma, hangover cure, and my heart, all at the same time?

A grilled chicken super burrito from Ocean Taqueria.

I'm not a fan of burritos because I don't like hand-held foods (no, I do not like ice cream in a cone, I'll take it in a cup please).  I also have yet to find a burrito that truly meets my southern California standards for Mexican food, and several jaunts into the Mission have left me feeling disgruntled.

When my coworker Caleb and I decided to go have lunch, he nixed my idea of going to the neighborhood Korean place so we could check out the waitress that our supervisor's been crushing on, although not for that reason - he just didn't want Korean food.  He then brought up the idea of burritos, so off we went, and we found parking pretty easily.

We both got a grilled chicken super burrito, which basically had a whole mess of things: freshly-grilled-on-the-spot chicken, onions, and peppers, rice, your chocie of beans (black or refried), pico de gallo, sour cream, mild, medium or hot sauce, guacamole, more types of salsa, and lettuce.  Wrap this all in a huge flour tortilla and you get an instantly happy stomach.

I think the freshly-grilled chicken and peppers made the difference here - it added so much flavor, and it wasn't overwhelmed by the sauces or sour cream.  Perrrrfect balance of all the flavors without tasting too greasy and fatty.

Oh, and THEY TAKE CREDIT CARDS!!!  TAKE THAT, Mission trolls!

Food coma: check
Hangover cured: check
Love: check
author: Tori S.

description:
I've been here twice - once for lunch and the other for dinner and I must say that Ocean Taqueria has turned me into a fan.  First of all, the staff are very nice, friendly and accommodating.  I asked them for flour tortillas instead of the corn tortillas that came with my shrimp plates and they were like, "Sure, no problem."  Also, when they pack your order to go, the food is not just slopped inside the box.  They actually take some pride in the presentation and you can tell that they put their heart in the cooking.  Both times, I went there, I was drawn by the wonderful aromatic smells coming from the kitchen, as soon as I was in front of their door.  I always thought it was strange how you can go in some restaurants and not smell their food cooking?

I tried their Shrimp a la Diabla (very spicy shrimp, though you can adjust the heat level to your preference) and their Shrimp al mojo de ajo (garlic shrimp).  Both the dishes were super tasty and flavorful, with bright and fresh ingredients (guacamole, pico de gallo, sour cream, rice and your choice of beans).
author: Danielle O.

description:
I wanted to like this place, but the burritos just have no flavor. My burrito was mostly filled with the rice, no balance on chicken, beans or other ingredients. 

Two stars because everyone was nice, and I Iike the garlic in their salsa.
author: Nic W.

description: Came with my friend cause we were starving. We got the Carne Asada Jumbo Burrito. He kept saying how huge and satisfying it is. They grill everything to order to thats pretty good. As they were assembling the Jumbo Burrito, I didn't think it was that big and my friend thought the same. He said last time he ordered it they stuffed it with more goodies so I was kinda disappointed. They should be more consisted on what they serve. However, the food was really good, the meat was flavorful and not dry, veggies and beans complimented the burrito. I didn't get full, but it was very good.
author: Juan F.

description:
I have eaten at this place several times.

I recommend trying tacos. Skip the beans, guacamole, sour cream, so that you get more flavor from the meat and other ingredients in every bite. The tacos are huge.

Pluses:
* The staff is friendly and casual
* You can interact with the cook across the counter. Last time I went, the cook asked if I wanted 'grilled green onions' (cebollitas) on the side. It's nice to see them go the extra mile for a customer, right in front of you.

Minuses:
* They charge for chips, but the bags they sell have too many. I wish they would just throw some in for free on the side
* atmosphere is so-so
author: Xavier A.

description: Amazing burrito. Carne Asada Super with Tomato Tortilla on point. Hole in the wall feel just the way it should be. Great food! Gets crowded at lunch
author: Scott S.

description:
I have NO idea why El Burrito Express down the street has better reviews and I've been going there instead of Ocean Taqueria for the past 2 years. Seriously???

Ok, so Ocean Taqueria seems a bit sketch when you walk in. I was so confused, couldn't find the menu (which is high along the wall before the cashier), didn't know where to order (directly to the cook in the back) or where to pay. Good thing I was the only one there that Saturday afternoon, so the guy manning the grill was super patient. He asked me what I wanted and since I didn't know, I just said everything in my super burrito. He grilled the carne asada, onions and green peppers on the spot, so you know it's fresh. Everything including shredded lettuce, sour cream, guacamole and all of the salsas. You can tell him if you don't want spicy, but everyone who knows me, knows I love my spicy food and spicy salsa is no exception.

I walked home with the burrito. Usually when I walk home with an El Burrito Express burrito, it's cold. No, not this burrito from Ocean Taqueria. It was hot, the veggies were still a bit crunchy and the juice from the carne asada is running down the burrito and onto the plastic bag. So satisfying, considering this isn't the mission or SD. Sad to say but I won't be visiting El Burrito Express anymore when Ocean Taqueria is just a few doors down.
author: Angela S.

description:
Best burrito in Pac Heights. Fresh tortillas, salsas, guacomole, and pretty much all their sides. The chips are fresh (surprisingly, many taquerias, like the "famous" Cancun Taqueria buy their chips from a store)! But not these guys! And as for the burrito size, are extra huge here, so be warned!

The only reason this place doesn't get 5 stars is because the atmosphere is a bit drab. The space is long and extra narrow (even by SF standards!). Also, the prices are a little higher than your average taqueria.

Recommends: try the super shrimp burrito & their fresh pineapple juice.
author: Matt D.

description:
I've been here twice. The first time was better than the second. I ordered a baby burrito with carnitas. After reading the reviews, maybe I should've ordered the carne asada since it's cooked fresh. The carnitas did not taste fresh. They were dry. 

Also, I was bummed that chips weren't included. 

Decor was dingy, which usually isn't a problem with me. But the tables were so sticky that I didn't want to touch anything. Not even my burrito.
author: Melissa T.

description: Best burrito I've had in a while.  All the meat for the burrito (and for any other order I'm sure) is cooked fresh to order.  The cook puts a special sauce on the meat while he cooks it; he wouldn't tell me what was in it but it gives the meat unbelievable flavor!!!  Definitely give this place a try.  Ocean Taqueria has my vote for best burrito in the city.
author: Daniel C.

description: Best place to get a Mexican burrito in PAC hits.   Simple fare, much like you would find in the Mission. Call in advance and they will have your order waiting for you. They offer all the different wraps you want... plain, whole wheat, spinach.  A great place for a meal on the run.  We order and pick up, but you can eat on the premises if you like, but there's not much atmosphere.
author: Cynthia T.

description:
I absolutely love this place. My boyfriend and I stumbled upon it a few months ago and now I can't stop going. 

It's so close to where I live, cheap and so delicious. Everyone in there is super nice and friendly. I get the baby chicken burrito and they are the perfect size and everything is made right in front of you. So delicious!
author: Coco K.

description:
Pretty terrible - the place itself is very dirty. And the guy making your burrito will be handling people's money, and then using his bare hands to grab lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro, etc for your burrito. Gross. 

The chips are incredibly stale and off-tasting, and after eating two bites of the wet, sloppy, and stomach-turning burrito, I couldn't eat it anymore....and I never throw away food. yikes. Move-on.
author: Arjun B.

description:
A lot of my judgment in a restaurant is based on how receptive the staff/management is to my light-hearted banter. At Ocean Taqueria, I know I'm always in for a good chuckle or two. It helps to speak Spanish, but I've witnessed a few initially awkward language misunderstandings turn into echoing laughter. 

My favorite thing about OT is their utilization of the grill. While most burrito venues readily slap on day-old ingredients that have been sitting in a murky pool of questionable liquid all day, these gentlemen will sizzle your onions, bell peppers, and seasoned meat right in front of your very eyes.  The only issue is that this place can be hit or miss- I've had burritos that range from incredible to decent, never bad.

The other day, aforementioned light-hearted banter turned into a full blown conversation about Mexico, drug lords, cerveza, and hot sauce (including samples). These guys will treat you like a true friend, if you let them. I left with more hot sauce than I know what to do with, and a free Corona to top it all off.
author: William H.

description:
I come here a few times a month for their fajita burrito. They cook the chicken and steak to order which I really like and I have never tried their other meats. They make them right in front of you so you can tell them exactly what you want in it, plus their salsa are bomb.

If you're not in the mood for a burrito their tacos are also excellent and large portions.
author: James W.

description: I love this little gem! So sad I moved away from this neighborhood. Pro tip: Their mild/medium salsa (it's the best one there) is casually called the "Lady Gaga." Ask for it with your chips - it's amaze! :)
author: Allison D.

description:
My boyfriend was raving about this place for a long time, and I had already tried El Burrito Express (which I love by the way), so I decided to skip over EBX for one day and give Ocean Taqueria a shot.

I was not disappointed!  We stepped in line and ordered a Jumbo Burrito for the two of us (it's basically two burritos tied up into one).  They cook the meat to order and everything tastes so fresh!  You have the ability to choose whatever goes into your burrito.  The staff is very friendly, and we made some chit chat while our order was being made and rung up.  

Great place to stop by for a delicious burrito!
author: Can C.

description: I love the steak burritos from this place! It looks like a hole in the wall and does not feel like the most inviting looking place, but the food is delicious and it's not very expensive. I recommend you get your food to go, it's most enjoyable at home.
author: Samantha H.

description: Love this spot. Just a solid burrito made by a great group of people. Friendly service... my favorite local taco spot. Love the carne asada and the pork.
author: Michael S.

description: Got a carnitas taco fully loaded and it was great. Very reasonably priced for its size! Nice staff and quick service
author: Jason L.

description: LOVE this neighborhood spot! The veggie quesadilla is always perfection. And they'll give you extra guacamole if you're nice.
author: Lindsay U.

description: Absolutely delicious. Their tacos were huge, fresh and filled with flavor. Loved this place and will definitely be back
author: David S.

description:
Best burrito in San Francisco. They grill the chicken/steak for each meal while you are in line - if that doesn't mean anything to you, try it, you'll never be the same.

The main chef is really friendly/funny too - talk to him!
author: Matthew F.

description:
get the corn quesadilla with carnitas and all the fixins!  it is like a taco sandwich.  Great alternative if you are not up for the 2lb burrito or flour quesadilla.  oooohhhh so yummy!  They also have agua frescas.  The people that work there are super friendly.  the guy at the register made me a "special treat"... 1/2 horchata and 1/2 strawberry.  OH YEAH!  my new favorite  ;)

This place is a little spendy but the food is so so good.  I love that eveything is cooked to order and not sitting around in bins all day.  So allow cooking time when getting food from here.  Not the taqueria to go to if you want to run in "really quick" to get a burrito to-go.
author: Monette P.

description:
Yesterday was "pay my bet debt day" and met up with two ex coworkers/bosses in the City for lunch. Every single year I end up losing our annual NCAA tournament pool and it's me who gets stuck with the lunch tab. Lucky for me they are both men of simple tastes and usually a simple Taqueria will do.

Upon arriving on Divisidero we attempted to lunch at Burrito Express, but the line was a mile long and were three hungry soles who needed a fast remedy and take care of our low blood sugar issue. Just a few short steps away is Ocean Taqueria. We walked in and found plenty of open seats and a much shorter line. 

If you go, make sure to follow the rules and get in the right line. As you walk towards the cash register there are two lines, one to pay and one to order. The confusing part is you encounter the pay line first, but you quickly learn that you must proceed to the back to order.

The menu is exactly what you would expect from a casual Taqueria. Burritos, quesadillas and nachos everywhere. All you really need to decide on is if you want the "Super" size or the "Regular". Both of my ex coworkers went with the "Super carne asada burrito" with everything and I went with the "Regular carne asada quesadilla". The assembly line for your order is right in front of you and the burrito/quesadilla guy lays your tortilla out in front and asks which fillings you would like. There are plenty to choose from, rice, different kinds of salsas, guacamole and three kinds of beans (whole, re fried and black). Both of my friends went with the works.

When it came time for my quesadilla to be assembled, the counter guy asked what I would like. I was little confused in that usually a quesadilla is just cheese (and the carne asada as I had requested). I responded with just the cheese please. He then rolled it up rather than laying it flat and it just looked a cheese burrito. I don't know about you, but I prefer my quesadillas flat.

My quesadilla wasn't bad, but it was little soggy and did not like eating wrapped up in foil. It wasn't very "cheesy" nor did the tortilla sing to me with flavor. I ate half as I lost interest fairly quickly and figured I would save my caloric intake for dinner. 

Overall I came away unimpressed and probably would go elsewhere. It did do the trick for what we needed which was just to catch up and share stores about what troubles we have gotten into over the past year.
author: Rene C.

description: Aka now El City Taqueria.  The carnitas anything is bomb.com sautéed with spices and a ton of other goodness.  Enjoy!
author: Matt B.

description:
By no means will the food at Ocean Taqueria knock your socks off, but if you're hankering for some quick Mexican comfort food while hob-nobbing around Lower Pac Heights, it'll do the trick.

On Cinco de Mayo, they were handing out free shots of tequila with every burrito purchased, which allllllllllllmost compels me to kick down another star, but I gots to keep it real. It's A-OK all the way around.
author: Ruggy J.

description: The burritos are like 7 or 8 bucks. They make everything in front of you. When you ask for extra guacamole, they give you extra guacamole. You know it's authentic because they speak Spanish in front of you while they make your burrito. We get the chicken and steak burrito. The best burritos are always in places like this.
author: Nathan H.

description: Ordered the enchilada , it was pretty good and the portion was large. One very important note is that the food has a lot of salt and msg that will leave you thirsty for the rest of the day !!!! I had Ocean Taqueria for lunch and didn't even finish the whole meal and I was constantly drinking water for the rest of the day. Maybe that's why it tastes good ...cause of the MSG...
author: Lucy C.

description: Certainly not the best burritos in town but for the neighborhood they are pretty good. More flavor and authentic than other places. Other places often tone down the flavor for non latins, I find this place tastier than burrito express. It is a bit of a dump, but burrito express is as well.   I saw him wash his hands twice before preparing my food and another guy handled the money.
author: Matt A.

description: Very average tacqueria, prices were reasonable and the food was just ok.
author: Brian W.

description:
I was thoroughly impressed with this taqueria when I revisited it last week. I had come a few times before but always random (and usually drunken) occasions like after B2B. So after being out of the country for 3 months I was definitely in search of an excellent burrito. I was hesitant to come here, but they pulled through.

The staff were very friendly and funny, especially if you speak Spanish with them. We had fun making my burrito, mixing the two types of green and red chicken meat and adding spicy salsa and anything else we could think of.  2 burritos, chips, salsa, and horchata came out to $20. 

The burrito was large and awesome. I could only eat half - which is very shocking and definitely a disappointment to myself. The meat was tender and flavourful and the burrito contained the right amount of components. The Horchata was a little chalky but it is hard to find some that isn't.

So to my surprise, I will defintitely be returning to this place. Especially since my friend lives right down the street now!
author: Rachel G.

description: When El Burrito was closed I decided to try out Ocean Taqueria.  I vaguely remembered having a not amazing burrito there years ago, but I figured I was just getting a veggie burrito (literally rice, cheese, beans and avocado), so how could that go wrong?  Well....first, the taste of my burrito was just off.  Seriously - four ingredients but they tasted strange.  If I had to guess I'd say they add sugar to the beans, but I can't be sure.  Further, i was the ONLY person in there.  I'm pretty outgoing and friendly, but I could NOT get these guys to crack a smile.  I felt I was putting them out by ordering a burrito. It was just strange.
author: Cori D.

description: Two words: Habanero salsa.  I love heat and I still haven't found another burrito place in SF that delivers it with such flavor and intensity as Ocean does.  Watch out.  It's hot.
author: Alan B.

description:
This time, the staff were extra friendly and recommended that I try the Pollo Rojo Super Burrito. Twas awesome!

Great flavor and very moist fillings make this one of the better burritos I've had in the city.(I prefer places in Oakland)

Yeah, the set-up is funky; but it won't stop me from returning. this is my new lunchtime spot.
author: Justin C.

description: I love that they have a fruit plate with toothpicks for customers to nibble on as we await our beautiful, delicious and generously served food. The place is close to home and I hope it stays that way.
author: Valorie L.

description: Ocean, I would say that the food is not so great for the price especially there nachos. I would not recommend. I want to add that as I was ordering a steak burrito that the person who was rolling my burrito had a band aid on and fingers were not as clean and then he rung me up with no gloves. I question there cleanliness?
author: Stephanie R.

description: A Mission-like taqueria in Pac Heights, thank god. Helps me avoid the Mission. Cheap and delicious Mexican food. Solid sized portions, especially for the price. Pork Verde, do it.
author: Anthony T.

description:
This review is solely based upon a business angle, as the food is actually very good. That being said, I will not be going back to this establishment, and here's why. Tonight was my third visit, and all three times the staff has tried to rip me off when I arrive at the register, and this time, I was not going to back down. I ordered a quesadilla with only beans, cheese, rice, and salsa, advertised at $5.50, and when I get to the register, the guy tries to charge me $8.21 (???). I walked him over to the posted-on-the-wall menu, and pointed out to him that my order did not include any meat, guacamole, or sour cream, and that I was not going to be just another perceived "sucker" from the lower pacific heights neighborhood they might be used to dealing with. On my previous visit, I ordered a regular vegetarian burrito, with no extras, advertised at $5.50, and I was ordered to pay $7.00, just because of the addition of cheese. I work as a retail/food service supervisor, and such an addition does not warrant an extra charge of $1.50, considering that the cheese comes in a 3LB bag, and is a very cheap, processed item, not high quality in the least bit (I would know, I order the stuff for my company). 
So after all that, the cashier tries to make me agree to a $7.21 sale, I still won't back down, he talks to his co-worker in Spanish, assuming he is berating me in a tongue I do not understand, we settle on an even $6.50 and I leave. The conduct of the staff here is just plain and simply bad and dishonest business, and I will never come back. I advise anyone who plans on going here to be very specific with what they order. Do not let them tack on extra costs, thinking that you are another yuppie from the neighborhood who makes "so much" that another few dollars and cents doesn't faze you.
author: Sean R.

description:
I've probably had food from this place 4 or 5 times since moving to SF, and if this were any other type of food I might be able to give it three stars, but it seems like for the past year I've eaten Mexican food like it's my job, and I have to say "I've experienced better." 

The past two times I ate here I was basically forced to since the far superior El Burrito Express two doors down was closed (bastards). 

The service is pretty bad (although I will say the last time I was here the two guys behind the counter were the nicest people I've dealt with yet). It's a very "Soup-nazi" like atmosphere they have going on. You quickly give the guy behind the counter your order and when they ask you what kind of meat, veggies, etc, you want on your burrito, quesadilla, taco, etc. you better answer quickly (like 1 or 2 nanoseconds) and don't ask any questions or you'll get a surly stare. 

There isn't anything from here that stands out. I take that back actually...they do have good guac. It's not the real thick Chevy's-style table-side kind, it's a little bit runnier, but I wouldn't call it runny (make sense?). I've had burritos with grilled chicken and carne, as well as quesadilla's with the same meats and everything has been pretty bland (this goes for the beans and rice as well). 

The food here is a little cheaper than The Little Chihuahua or The Green Chile Kitchen (and it should be), but more expensive than El Burrito Express (and it shouldn't be). They never give you chips, with your food and I didn't realize until seeing another review here it's because they charge two bucks for them. What a joke! 

Like others have mentioned the place isn't that clean or really that nice looking, but that I don't mind. In fact, places like this usually have really good food, which makes the fact the Ocean Taqueria doesn't that much more disappointing...
author: George A.

description: Overpriced, not authentic, but the cook is friendly and it's good for a quick fix.
author: Brian J.

description:
I am extremely lucky to live two blocks away from this place.  I have tried many Taquerias in the city but in my opinion, Ocean has the best Carne Asada burrito.

The line starts from the back of the restaurant.  I usually order the "baby" Carne Asada with onions and bell peppers.  It is made fresh to order as the steak with the onions and bell peppers are grilled on the spot right in front of you, and not pre-cooked like many other Taquerias.  I'll then select black beans, pico, guacamole and one scoop of habanero sauce.  I'll also get tortilla chips (which they make themselves and fry) to go with two containers of hot salsa.  The burrito is not a dry burrito and is extremely flavor full.  If you are ever in the neighborhood, this is a must eat location.
author: Shad B.

description: Reviewing a taqueria in SF is kind of like when people clap upon landing when you fly somewhere. Why are you clapping? The landing part is included in the trip, in fact its essential and nothing to get excited about. Clap at takeoff, that's at least a miracle. WIth that said, unless something is glaringly wrong Taqueria's are all pretty good. This one though I am reviewing for the simple fact that it doesn't look appealing from the outside and happens to be next door to another taqueria. The food is consistent, the guys are friendly, and despite its odd layout and decor, has some flavorful dishes to satisfy that taqueria craving. But, like an uneventful landing, nothing to clap about.
author: Z P.

description: Great food. Everything grilled on the spot
author: Ron H.

description:
My favorite taqueria in San Francisco. I'd recommend either the grilled chicken or carne asada. They grill both to-order using fresh, quality meat. The red sauce is the perfect combination of heat and flavor. All of the employees are very friendly and nice. They always have some food to nibble on for people waiting in line and will very often invite you to have a shot of tequila with them. 

I went in just the other day and they told me that the Ocean avenue location will be reopening soon, hopefully within the month. I heard 2 explanations, that there is a landlord dispute and that they are redoing the interior.
author: Sivan W.

description:
It's the simple things in life, like a  fine burrito. The layout of this place is a little strange, having you walk to the end of the restaurant to order, however you soon realize it's because you're standing next to the cook you does it all right in front of you. 
Carne Asada done right and great, and my friend enjoyed her veggie burrito.
author: dave m.

description:
My favourite Burrito joint in town.
Don't be put off by the shabby decor, this place does all the important things right in making top quality mexican food.
Meat is cooked to order in front of you, the grilled chicken burrito's are great, chorizo and egg breakfast burrito's are the best hangover cure! Everything is fresh and tasty.
author: Alex P.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE! This is the worst Mexican food I have ever had. 

I ordered a steak burrito with black beans. Everything was edible, but very very bland. I asked for some hot sauce, and it was also very bland. 

Also had guacamole for the chips, which was very very watered down with almost no flavoring. I don't even know if they used avocados. 

The only reason I even ate the food was because I was starving after hiking all day.
author: Joy Y.

description: It's called "Ocean Taqueria" because they originated as a shop on Ocean Avenue. Unfortunately, that shop closed down a year or so ago. Now, whenever I'm in the city I'll drive all the way to Divisadero to have more of this good stuff. Their carne asada nachos are the best I've had.
author: Barish O.

description: Came in with a few of my co-workers for lunch, ordered the super Burrito which was very good, the Best thing that they cooked the meat as you ordered, so the burrito has great flavor, love the music they play, make you feel like you're Mexican liked, will be back again, great job guys.
author: Terry T.

description:
Two Words: Yes Please 

These guys have got it right. You want a real burrito, look no further. They grill the onions and peppers with the meat right in front of you - they even melt the cheese like a quesadilla before putting all the good into the burrito. Beast Mode. 

You like nachos? No problem - they give you enough nachos to feed the family. 

Solid Mexican food.
author: Kendra S.

description:
I liked this Ocean Taqueria better than the one on Ocean.  The staff was friendlier and my quesadilla seemed extra delicious.

It's weird ordering though.  First time there I wasn't sure where to stand.

Good food, good salsa.  My dad loved his fish taco.  Wish it was in a more accessible place though.

3.5!
author: Kimiko Q.

description: Run-of-the-mill taqueria that is one of the few options in the Pac Heights/Western Addition neighborhood. Decent assortment of meats and options but not necessarily the freshest or most flavorful. If you got a burrito fix, this should get it done but the quality is not even close to what you can experience in the Mission. Ocean should be only for emergency Mexican food cravings only.
author: Ed L.

description: This little hole-in-the-wall can be a little hard to find, maybe that's why there never seems to be a line here. But it's tasty food and relatively cheap for the neighborhood. This is my kind of place and will keep coming back!
author: Katie L.

description: Decent and somewhat authenticate Mexican food that's not in The Mission. The chef really knows what he's doing, and their food is always delicious. I like it too because it's not usually too busy, and the staff is really friendly. I usually order the nachos and they heap on the toppings. If you don't want to wait at Burrito Express next door (they suck anyways) come here.
author: Beth H.

description:
Great place to pick up a big, fat, juicy, dirty burrito.  

Expect to get a hefty scoop of rice, massive amounts of meat, and enough of the other crap (beans, peppers, onions, guac, salsa) that the tortilla just barely wraps. But don't expect the folks behind to counter who handle money to wash their hands before they wrap your burrito. The dirtiness is probably what makes the burrito taste good.
author: R C.

description:
From the sea to your tortilla.

Tilapia was the fish of the day. Despite ordering a baby burrito pretty sure I got the whole thing and maybe his sibling. It was a massive serving.

Swam exceptionally well with black beans, mild salsa and lettuce (no charge) in a tomato tortilla (changing it up for the day).

Good value for $7. Can't imagine eating anything larger.

(yes I could)
author: Jason B.

description: By San Francisco standards, this is very weak Mexican food. Will definitely not return here for another meal. el burrito express 2 is significantly better with similar prices.
author: Ben M.

description:
I've been going to this bastion of awesometown ever since it was at ocean and a block away from my house. Now I travel across town 15 minutes for this glorious and most delicious mexican cuisine. The jumbo burrito is the length of my arm. THE LENGTH OF MY ARM. It's two supers put together for about 14 bucks, if memory serves correctly. Add to it that they grill the chicken and/or steak in front of you rather than that pre grilling and keeping it warm with water and you got my support. It's delicious. Out of the hundreds of times I have gone to this establishment only ever had one bad burrito.

I tried the nachos with steak and they PILE IT ON. They give you hella healthy portions. Extra points there. Furthermore, the staff is always friendly, and for what ya get the prices ain't too bad.  

I'll back it up 110 percent! 

(boyfriend writing this.)
author: Emilie R.

description: A proper no-frills joint. Order en espagnol (or just greet with "Hola Amiiiiiigo"), take it to go, get extra guacamole  ... Extra points for their spanish rice being cooked in a home-made broth, that really melds together all the essential burrito-o-logical elements.  4 Stars! (5 Stars for the neighbourhood)
author: I. O.

description:
I have eaten here a few times. Sub par menu for sub par mexican food. The last time me and the man where there, we waited our turn in line by leaning against a wall. 
Suddenly, I noticed the wall was wet. The fuckers had just painted and didn't put a sign or anything. And, the guy behind the counter totally saw us and didn't warn us. So, after I realized my dress, bag and sweater had just been ruined, I told them about it. They didn't even apologize!!! 
My bf wanted to eat, but I was over it. I stood there angrily while they made our food and the chef tried to joke with us by tossing the burrito up in the air as though he were a pizza chef. Please. We're not 12.

We got our food and the bastards actually charged us. Oh wait, they gave us a $2 discount and told us the paint was primer and would wash out. Well, two washes later, and my stuff is still ruined. So is his sweatshirt. We went back. They still refused to even apologize. I demanded that he give us at least our money back. 
I refuse to ever go here again.
author: joanna r.

description:
Stopped in on Sunday November 6th, 2011 - around 7 PM. After entering - the place was empty I proceeded all the way to the back where I ordered a chicken burrito to go after looking around for a few minute trying to figure out how to order.

The burrito was put together in about a minute or so - rice, pinto beans, chicken or a tortilla which did not hold very well compared to other SF places. Overall burrito was about $7.25 or so with tax.

I would recommend other mexican places in the area over this one.
author: Brian D.

description: During the school year, this is a must when I go off campus for lunch. I always get a grilled chicken quesadilla, which is filled with rice, cheese, and copious amounts of diced chicken. Whether I eat it there or get it to go, it's always delicious and warm, and the portion is huge. They give me incredulous looks when I tell them to put nothing on it (no salsa, guac, etc.) but they end up joking about it anyways. The guys working there are good natured and always have a smile on their face. The line gets long around lunch time because students come here, but service is relatively fast and the food is pretty cheap, considering its location.
author: KC W.

description: Best Burrito in SF hands down. They don't do anything fancy and this isn't your California "lets add healthy crap to your food" type of place. If you want amazing food at a cheap price this is the place. They make all their food fresh and it is very authentic but don't go in thinking its a healthy place cause this is gut busting, over sized, in your face mexican food that will leave you begging for more.
author: Adam V.

description: I just finished a delicious regular carne asada burrito from Ocean Taqueria. The burrito was so good I might brave the BARTless (yet another lame strike) public transportation to go enjoy another one! I enjoyed spicy salsa and refried beans on my delightful burrito.
author: Chris B.

description: I didn't think the carnitas was that good. Maybe I should be getting some seafood there based on the name but while the portion was generous the Carnitas just didn't really bring anything special flavor or texture wise.
author: Misha T.

description:
I loved the plywood menu written in sharpie. It totally made my day. The guy who works here is super nice and while your order may get messed up a bit, it is all worth it in the end because you leave with a solid burrito that you will be proud to put in your belly. The vegetarian burrito can be vegan and it is quite good. 

Your first instinct to run from the hand written menu is wrong, dont trust it. Go with the magic.
author: Peter V.

description:
5 stars for the food, 4 overall as it is a as a small local taqueria that could use a little refresh.  That said, I have eaten here a lot and the food has always been fantastic.  No experience with their take-out, but every main item  I have had at the taqueria itself has been my favorite of its type. 
So, I've had a bunch of their burritos and their quesadilla.  Delicious, well prepared and huge!   Their "Baby Burrito" is a meal in itself   Their Super Burrito could cover two meals.   The 12-inch could feed a small family.  
Meats are alway tasty and well-cooked.  (Never had the weird piece of gristle that pops up in most other places from time to time.). Fillings are fresh and generous.  
Only issue is sometimes the chips are a little stale.  Oh well.
Decor is a little funky and a bit on the grungy side, but never had an issue from it.  (Bathroom is always clean, though...)
Service is always easy and friendly. 
I've eaten at El Burrito Express, Super Burrito, Pancho Villa's, etc.  They are all very good, but I have yet to have a Carne Asada or Pollo Asado burrito better than Ocean/City Taqueria.
author: Marco I.

description:
Good burrito fix, nachos are allright, hot sauce is pretty hot. Pretty satisfied with this place, Ocean Taqueria is a quick stop burrito joint. It always does the fix for me, pretty consistent. They give you pretty good portions too, actually just right for the hungry man!

They can improve on better tasting beef and fresher lettuce, but other than that, they are pretty tasty.
author: Howard J.

description: My sis picked me up a chicken burrito from this place. It's decent, but I've definitely had better. The flavour is just right though and there's no bad aftertaste that some burritos leave in your mouth so those are definitely pluses. The size is just enough...not overwhelming but enough to keep you full. The only complaint I would have is that it has a lot of beans in it. There were too many beans and not enough of the other stuff. Otherwise, it's a decent burrito.
author: Amy J.

description: Absolutely awful. Went in with one of my friends and we ordered a cheese quesadilla. When the food got to us, the cheese was completely uncooked and immediately gave us stomach aches after eating it. After about ten minutes of stomach pain, my friend needed to pull over to the side of the road to vomit. Later that night, I also vomited. I will never come back, the food was absolutely terrible.
author: Stacie A.

description:
I like this taqueria, a solid neighborhood staple.

Service- pretty good in English, better in Spanish.
Ambience- multitude of flyers on wall are fun, but apart from that it's pretty cold.
Food- no complaints, except that you're at risk of getting messy. They'll make it however you want.

Price is right, place is welcoming, and the best part is I can go in whatever I'm wearing/whatever state I'm in, and they'll never make me feel weird :).
author: Ashley L.

description:
I have been a loyal customer of El Burrito Express for years now.  Sometimes it makes me a little sick, sometimes I rush in right at close and they tell me I'm too late......it's never an overly friendly experience but when that Super Bronco burrito comes together it is something special.

Last night I walked in at 9:00 and they were closed.  Finally time to give Ocean a try, and it was pretty damn good.  The staff was super friendly, the tortilla was really well grilled, I asked if they had avocado instead of gauc and he gave me a whole avocado for no extra charge.  I'll def be back.
author: Eamonn T.

description: This place has the authentic look which would make you think the food will be good, but something about it is just off the mark. I only come here if im dying for some local Mexican food (as its really close to my house) and its Sunday, because El Buritto Express isn't open on Sundays. That place is the truth, Oceans Taqueria is decent.
author: Nikko J.

description: I've been going here for a couple of years now. Good prices for the amount of food. I usually get a steak burrito, and the burritos here are the juiciest in the city. The tacos and nachos are just as good (fully packed too). The staff is friendly, and the looks of this place might be deceiving, but don't be discouraged.
author: John A.

description: Good eats and don't let the hospital like interior (being generous) scare you away as the product is fresh and tasty, and made to order.  I have only tried their chicken burritos but stop here often and it's a big hit in our family.  The owners seem nice and never have the nerve to tell them if they painted and freshened up the place, they could charge more and do more business.  The quality is there and recommend eating elsewhere unless institutional color scheme and lighting is your thing.
author: mike s.

description:
It was eh...

I ordered 2 tacos Pollo.  Guy asked me if I wanted everything on those, I answered yes because I did want everything that the menu listed as being on tacos on them.  Unfortunately the guy meant "everything" as in did I want the super tacos.  I didn't find out what he meant until it got time to pay.  It was a little annoying because 1) the menu tells you what is on a taco, super taco, burrito etc...  if I order a taco and don't say "hold the beans" and beans are on the menu as an ingredient well that means yes i want the beans, no need to ask about each individual ingredient.  2) I ordered tacos not super tacos, it seems like a sneaky way to up sell.

Anyway I was in a hurry and didn't want to wait for dude to make new tacos, and I had debated trying the super tacos anyway, so I just took those and went.  Not sure if it was a factor of getting them to go, I didn't travel very far.  But when I got home the tortillas were soggy to being in-edible.  Might be that they were loaded up with all the extra "super taco" shit or the whole togo thing or both.   Just something to keep in mind.

The "super tacos" were tasty, and very filling.   The first was sloppy but I could eat it by hand.  The second I needed a fork and could only finish half of it.

If it was across the street and I had a hunger for a taco, probably avoid the super tacos in the future, I'd stop in and eat them there.  But not worth going out of your way for.
author: Max Jonathan S.

description: It looks shady but taste good!!! Its strange cuz you have to order your food way in the back. Good mexican food and cheap!
author: Jess O.

description:
The best burrito ever!  I'm new to burritos, but my burrito connoisseur man friend says these are the best in town.

They have these potatoes you can add to your dish that are soaking in this wonderful, spicy, flavorful sauce...I always add them to my baby sized burrito and it really takes the burrito from "good", to HOLY F'BALLS THIS IS AWESOME!!!!!!

Get the potatoes.
author: Genevieve M.

description:
To be honest, El Burrito Express, just down the street is 10x better and granted I would eat there over Ocean Taqueria any day of the week; Ocean Taqueria is a fine substitute when EBE isn't open, like on Sundays for instance.

I ordered the Jumbo burrito and it was mightily Jumbo. Its basically two burritos long and was almost as long as my arm. Needless to say the burrito was too powerful for me and I was soundly defeated with about 4-5 inches left to go. However, size aside it was very tasty. The rice could have used a bit more punch, but it was not bad at all. 

In a nut shell: eat at EBE if its open, or if you eat there frequently give this place a go at least once. Don't order the Jumbo Burrito unless you mean business.
author: Joe D.

description: I'm a big fan of Ocean Taqueria. They make excellent burritos. I've been here a few times and had both the carne asada and veggie super burritos. Both were excellent. The burritos are made-to-order, they warm the tortillas on the flat grill, and then methodically construct and perfectly fold them and wrap in foil paper so you can eat them in your hands. The chips are good, the only thing holding this spot back is better salsa. If you want a flavorful burrito with all the toppings, this is the spot in pac heights.
author: J H.

description:
I love this place. Great burritos. At lunch time they put our trays of fruit for you to eat while waiting for your food. The people working are always super nice and chatty. Also, the walls are decorated with ads, the best one was for a pug dog walker. 

My only complaint about the place is their mild salsa, it's pretty bland.
author: Kami R.

description: Not too happy with this taqueria, & the way the customer service was, i had been waiting for 10minutes to order and then a person that spoke spanish cut in front of me and gave her order (in spanish) to the man on the grill. The man on the grill started on her order, in which i thought that wasn't fair at all since i had been waiting in line for so long. The prices are super high for being next to another taqueria that has more room, is courtious, and has a bigger menu! they need it get it together if they don't want to loose more business! For me that was it, I'm not going to give my hard  working money to a place where they don't aknowlege you if you don't speak their language! I simply walked out.. Boo..
author: Jamie M.

description: Great bang for your buck.  Little hole in the wall Mexican joint that gives you great portions and if you love cilantro, jalapeños, and avocado than go here! Not flashy just quick and easy.
author: Zachery N.

description:
Surprised to find an authentic taqueria in this part of town, we hopped into the first one we saw - Ocean Taqueria. You walk down this super long hallway to the kitchen area to place your order. There were 2 guys ahead of us, ordering massive burritos. I probably should have gotten that too but I had my heart set on a Super Quesadilla ($6.50). 

He starts with a huge tortilla, adds cheese and throws it on the grill. I asked for carne asada, so he throws that on too, and then adds onions and green peppers. That was a nice touch.

Once hot and melty, rice, beans, guac sauce, salsa, sour cream and hot sauce (if you so choose), and lettuce, gets thrown on. He tried to roll it but it wouldn't close. So he folded it in half and called it a day.

Chips and salsa are extra, and sodas are self serve. This is a no frills kind of place but frequented by authentic patrons. 

Overall I still think the places in the Mission are better. Maybe cuz I go when it's late in the night and the meats are more flavorful and juicy. But good to know there are some Mexican food options in the area.

Viva la Taqueria!
author: Cindy W.

description: I give them 3.5 stars for the food and extra 1/2 for awesome service. The guys who work here are super cool, but my friend was also hard core flirting with them! ha. I ordered the Super Burrito and couldn't decide if I wanted verde chicken or the red sauce chicken, so the guy said do you want both? I said hell yeah! it was yummy and moist, after standing in the Giants parade for hours anything was good. Oh, I've seen this before but not a fan, lettuce in the burrito, uh I don't like. I also got the watermelon fresca, not too sweet, on the money! The guy said sip some and I'll give you more, Hell yeah! Only one downfall, uhh I want free chips! No bueno.
author: Karen T.

description: I think this is the best taqueria outside of The Mission. A little hole in the wall place that looks slightly intimidating but instead is very inviting and friendly. They grill the tortilla, which I prefer, and they grill the meat on order. They ask you if you want onions and peppers (say YES!). Now my review is for a Super Baby Steak burrito but I imagine everything else is just as good. And yes, you want everything on it. Now I am not a fan of goopy burritos but I make an exception here because it is so flavorable and I love slurping up the juices. The burritos still manages to be tightly rolled and you get a bag of tri-colored chips. I love my Mission taquerias but this place is a front runner for Best in the City.
author: Marguerite E.

description:
I was surprised to see the rating on this place being anything more than 3 stars, but to each his own.

I went here yesterday because I was craving a burrito and I love El Burrito Express which is just a few doors down, but after I drove around and finally found parking, they were closed on Sunday.  So, on my way back to my car, I saw this place was open and decided a burrito can't be that bad.

I walked in and the guys were very nice and it was kind of awkward because they kept speaking to me in Spanish even though I kept answering in English!  I don't know much Spanish at all so was surprised that I even knew enough to get by yesterday.  They were asking me more than just whether or not I wanted cheese or not, but whether I was eating at home and all kinds of stuff.  Either way, I got by!
