As I was watching them make my burrito, everything was runny.  It looked like everything had water added to it.  The guac, the beans, the sour cream - all  very runny.  They put very little rice on, very little beans, very little sour cream and a bunch of pork which I was semi afraid of eating because it looked more like pork flavored product than actual pork.  So I get a very empty burrito for 8 bucks.

This is the only time that I have been here, but I don't think I will waste money trying it again.  Yes, my place is closed on Sundays so if I am really craving a burrito on a Sunday, I will just head to one of the other hundreds of Taquerias in this city.  This place is sooo not worth it and completely didn't satiate my craving.
author: M M.

description: This is my favorite place to get a veggie burrito in SF. It's open late, very friendly people, it's usually empty, so you don't have to wait, but most importantly - they make absolutely great burritos.
author: Lukáš L.

description: Everything tastes fresh and the employees are super friendly. One of the best burritos in the city.
author: Harrison G.

description: The Best Taqueria in the city. We were eating in their Ocean location ever since 2003 and were very sad to see them leave the neighborhood. We drive to Divisadero every few weeks when we want burritos. The Grilled chicken and Crane Asada are made to order unlike other places that it is already grilled when you walk in. You need to know what you want but they will do whatever you ask. They have peppers and onions  that they will grill for you to add to your order (it is not mentioned in the menu). sometimes they have problem understanding English since I do not speak Spanish but they got a lot better with the language in the last year. very nice employees, good service. not a great place to a sit down meal, just not a vivid restaurant, but the best burritos.
author: Edith L.

description:
After a long run
I'm not hungry anymore
Jumbo Burrito
-----

I'd like to start this review by saying that I always find it amusing (and kind of stupid) when an establishment named after a street (normally a tell-tale sign of a less than creative force behind the venture) goes beyond its namesake street and opens a new location on a different street (Irving Pizza on Geary Blvd being another example).  Congratulations on expanding your turf--too bad you couldn't come up with a better name this time, either.

I mean, c'mon, it's not like restaurants named after streets have the type of brand recognition and reputation that would be worth leveraging.

That aside, I really thought I would never go to this Ocean Taqueria.  El Burrito Express on Divisadero is just so good that I couldn't see myself going anywhere else.  And the one time I went to Ocean Taqueria on Ocean, I wasn't impressed, though I don't remember it being bad either.

Then today I ran 15 miles and I was craving a burrito, but El Burrito Express failed me: they are closed on Sunday.  I was disappointed, but I figured Ocean Taqueria would seize this opportunity to gain some business on their competitor's off-day, and I was right.  As it turns out, they offer a Jumbo Burrito for $9.50.  I had to have it.

The Jumbo Burrito is delicious and the main reason you need to go to Ocean Taqueria the next time you are starving.  Try it.
author: Jin D.

description:
Baby burrito = perfect size. Just good, divey Mexican food. I'm not even sure what was in my veggie burrito, they just sort of slopped a bunch of stuff into a tortilla (I said no to the potatoes they offered me, though) and wrapped it up to go for me.

Despite this, I don't think I'd ever come back here. I was a first-timer with no idea how to order, and don't think I'll get over how awkwardly excruciating the exchange was in trying to get that damn burrito from the kitchen to my mouth.
author: Jennifer B.

description: So we all know a burrito is pretty predictable and basic. You can make it super, of course, but still...when you think of burritos it almost kinda doesn't matter where you go, you know what you'll be getting. Well, I don't know how to explain why Ocean Taq's burritos are better and different BUT they just are! The meat is fresh, the lettuce and pico de gallo is fresh, the whole thing just tastes FRESH. The only reason why I'm not giving it 5 stars is because they don't have wet burritos!
author: Francesca S.

description:
Good burritos with some tasty sauces. 

The giant ones are too giant for me but you will do well for a quick bite here.

The interior could use some love.
author: Christopher F.

description:
I've tried both the express and ocean now. I must say, Ocean wins.

I do need to give Express another try, but nothing was poor about Ocean except for the lack of free chips. 

I had the super burrito with spicy pork (I don't think it was on the menu and was a special that day). but it was sweet, perfect spice and delicious. filling. 

the guys there were friendly and fun. i'm comin back and you beat xpress mondo mumbo jumbo in my eyes.
author: Victor B.

description:
Three words: Chicken Fajita Quesadilla. 

Its one of the best things you can get for $7.05 in the city. I have never had a stomach ache after eating at this establishment. The Chicken Fajita Quesadilla is ridiculously good. Can't go wrong with steak fajita. The key is fajita, if you don't want your meat made to order with peppers your crazy. The burritos are cool too, but quesadillia is where its at, keyword fajita.

I read reviews on Yelp, and its not necessary to state the obvious. You walk in Ocean Taq, and you're like "Whoa, Funky..." but you're wrong, its so good. Maybe you should take yourself out of there and go to Tortilla Heights, get sexually harassed, and a bad meal. 
The guys that work there are as cool as guys that work in taquerias get, yeah they get funny sometimes, but shit your at ocean taq people, its not exactly the ritz. Stop it, give the killer queso's the props it deserves and zip it with the ego's. Learn how to adapt, your not in Kansas anymore this is the CITY! 

Here's a script for you when at ocean taq:
Enter the establishment, walk down to the grill, look a the grillmaster and say,
"Chicken Fajita Quesadilla por favor"
Get it with everything you like, I like it with black beans, rice, and everything no sour cream, the spicy ain't that spicy if your scared, and the not spicy is good too. 
Behave yourself.
author: Adam S.

description: I had a good burrito here. It was fast, cheap, homey... A good experience.
author: Clayton S.

description: i'm not sure how this review can be less than 5 star! I get my meat freshly grilled to order with minimal (if-ever) any fat! now that's what i like... do i have to wait? most likely... and i might even have to speak up! i can handle that
author: Eva R.

description: I can eat their carne asada super burrito for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.  They cook the meet right in front of you and everything tastes fresh and healthy. The steak is not dry. It is juicy and the natural au jus is so tasty!  THe super burrito is about $8 and my fiance and I cut it in half and have a great meal because its pretty big. Don't forget to get both the green and red sauce on the side for your burrito to add more kick.
author: Shayenne G.

description:
Who knew a sequel could be so good???

I was skeptical due to the fact that I've never "loved" the place on Ocean, but stepping into the one on Divis is a completely different story. Even when busy, the guys are always friendly and joking, make food as fast as they can, give salsa samples while you wait and...wait for it... ARE OPEN ON SUNDAYS!!! (most of Divisadero should learn this too...). 

The enchiladas are amazing and more than plentiful, and the you can never go wrong with a carne asada burrito with all the fixins'. Also, they have a JUMBO burrito, which is something like an absurd 14 inches of burrito-y goodness. Nom nom nom...
author: Sarah C.

description: Tasty, fresh, and friendly, but pricey.  I like getting the combination rice plate with fish(tilapia), chicken, and steak with a cantaloupe juice.  This is a really pricey mexican joint though, expect to pay about $15.
author: Alex T.

description:
Good = 1.  Open on sundays, when you forget burrito express isn' t open  and you reallllly want a burrito.
            2.  Custom orders are A- OK (make your burritos wet if you want to!)
            3. Workers called me "amigo"
Bad = 1. Had to walk through a super narrow restaurant to get to the ordering stall 
          2. Not really a place to enjoy a view (unless you bring someone pretty with you)

Had to admit though, there burritos are good, but burrito express just two doors down is better.
author: Chirag V.

description: I just ate there an hour ago and ended up puking on the side of the road on the way home. I got a simple cheese quesadilla and it wasn't fully cooked (cheese was barely melted). My friend got sick from eating part of my quesadilla too. I had to pull over on the fucking side of the road and sit on the curb....I hate this food and will never be back. Orchata was warm. Not recommend, should have gone to Burrito Express
author: Rachel B.

description: Points for freshness. I ordered a fajita chicken burrito and they grilled up my meat and veg to order. Portion was good, I couldn't finish but it just didn't pop. Tasty but not great. For the price it's a keeper and I'll be back but I think there's better out there.
author: Marcus D.

description:
As far as taquerias go, I think this is the best one on this part of divis. The guy who runs it is always friendly. They will let you taste salsas if you aren't sure what you want.
The best thing to ask for is the habanero salsa. It's not ridiculously hot but it will get you sweating.
I don't order pick ups so I can't speak to their ability to correctly fill orders. But, there usually isn't too much of a line and you can always get in and out in 5 minutes with a super tasty burrito to fill yourself up with. Open till 10pm too which is a plus for us late night burrito fiends.
author: Eric Y.

description:
This place is very good.  The ambiance leaves a bit odd, but if you showed up for the ambiance and not the food, you're in the wrong place anyway.  

Don't even both with the menu hanging on the wall, just go to the back of the place and tell them what you want.  The good folks back there quite literally load you up (your burrito, taco, quesadilla, etc) with whatever you want - and it's all really good. 

Made the mistake of getting a quesadilla, and it fell to pieces with all the stuff packed in there.  Still, it was delicious.  Next time I'll order one of the burritos, so it doesn't fall apart on me.  

Also can see it as good place to go pick up a burrito to-go.

Two thumbs up.
author: Stuart V.

description:
Who knew there could be such a find north of the Mission?

I started eating here about a month ago after a great tip from a cabbie. When he told me they grill each customer's meat to order, I vowed to make the two-storefront trek past my usual spot.

I ordered two super steak tacos (thank you again, Mr. Cab Driver) and was blown away. They were loaded with succulent, piping hot meat, melting cheese between two slightly crisp mini-tortillas, and lots of veges and herbs. I'm drooling just thinking about them...

I've been back almost every weekend since then (after, and even sometimes during, my aerial dance classes at Dance Ground Keriac across the street). I love that the cooks flirt with me in Spanish.
author: Ali W.

description: Great tasting burrito. Order carne asada or pollo asada so they cook it fresh. I believe it was under $8. I will come here again. It's also open late, until like 10pm on some nights.
author: Marty J.

description:
Ocean Taqueria defies the idea that competition builds better products. Compared to the taqueria two stores down (El Burrito Express), there is NO reason to come here. None! If you are sitting down wondering what burrito place to go to in the neighborhood, GO TO EL BURRITO EXPRESS! Why is that? Well what makes a great burrito?

First of all, all great burritos have their tortillas GRILLED, preferably on both sides. Burrito Express does this, Ocean doesn't. They steam theirs and the tortilla is soggy and sticks to your teeth. Blah.

Two, meats. Though you might be fooled by the fact that Ocean throws their meat on the grill when you order it, don't be! It's bland and tough.

Even spread and heat. Your burrito should have its contents evenly spread throughout the burrito and both Express and Ocean do this. But the big difference is heat. Express's burritos are always warm and retain their heat through out the meal. Ocean's burritos are lukewarm at best and by the time your done, cold.

Next, size. For slightly more (as in about 50 cents more) you can get a burrito at Express much much larger than the puny, tasteless burritos at Ocean.

Service can be sketchy at ocean. Sometimes they're really nice with no problems, at other times they're rude, condescending, and misogynistic. I NEVER get that at El Burrito Express.

Ok ok, there is ONE reason to come to Ocean. That would be Sunday's. Express ISN'T OPEN ON SUNDAYS! What the hell!? The BEST day for a burrito, after a night of Saturday drinking, I crave, I starve for a good burrito the next day and I'm stuck with crappy Ocean. 

Someone should tell Catholics (I'm a former member) that on the Sabbath, God didn't just rest, he ate a burrito and how would he feel if his favorite neighborhood burrito place was closed? HUH!? What would he say? HUH!? How damned would you be if God had to go to HELL and get an Ocean burrito?

I wonder what Church they go to...
author: Robert P.

description:
This place is my favorite burrito in SF. The place is authentic, clean, and delicious. I would go here on a regular basis when living in SF 1-2x a week. The burritos are affordable and the soooo good. 

Try the Grilled Carne Asada Burrito with Onions and Peppers and all the works. 

Only negatives are:
-Be careful when calling in for pick up, they have a tendency to mess those up as no one really is fluent in English. You don't even really need to call it in, I have never been there where it has taken more than 5 minutes to get a burrito.
-The space is laid out really awkwardly, not really important but I wish they would redesign their layout.
author: Sam K.

description:
I'm very surprised that this place only has an average review of 3 stars...

I ordered a standard super burrito w/ carne asada and was blown away by the combination of all the flavors of the rice, beans, meat, veges and sauces that were in this heavy duty burrito.  I had a nice, cold refreshing horchata to compliment my meal and overall I was more than satisfied.

I hear this place gets packed but I went 3pm on a sunny sunday afternoon and the service was speedy and more than adequate.

I highly recommend ordering at Ocean Taqueria whenever in lowe pac heights or anywhere in the city!
author: Natan O.

description: Absolutely amazing. Get the grilled chicken burrito with everything. Habenero sauce on top. If this place closes, i will never be able to find another perfect burrito. Tip them please, they need to stay open until I die!
author: Mel F.

description: Huge fan! Excellent burritos, great refried beans, nice and spicy. good times.
author: Rohan S.

description: The grilled chicken burrito is to die for but watch out, a small one will do you.  I love the enchiladas as well and the tacos are worth the money, they're huge.  The best thing about this place is the staff is really friendly and aim to please.  They also have a sampling plate near the kitchen that is cool.
author: Eileen L.

description: After our plans for Thanksgiving went bust, we went to this place, which was open (much to my surprise) and I got a great veggie burrito for a good price. :)
author: Dani S.

description:
I went here last night with my boyfriend since he says it's really good. So I get the super steak burrito and he gets the jumbo steak burrito. OMG the jumbo burrito is SO BIG! Of course he didn't finish it... $10 for a jumbo burrito and I think $7 or $8 for a super burrito. I thought the burrito was okay. Definitely tried better ones.

The decor was kind of ghetto. You can't really read the menu since it looks like chicken scratch...

What's kind of funny is when my boyfriend called to ask when they close, right about when he was hanging up, the worker said MEOW and hung up. Hilarious!
author: Vivian L.

description: My expectations for divey taquerias are simple: quick friendly service, good food, free chips and salsa (excuuuuuse me Nick's Crispy Tacos).  Ate at Ocean Taqueria this evening and my expectations were met.  I ordered a spicy chicken quesadilla with everything, my bf got an al pastor burrito (perk alert:  They don't have al pastor but they will make you a batch if you want some).  Both dishes were muy rico, especially with the habanero salsa they make in house on the side!  The guys cooking were friendly so we bought them beers.  Today was one of the 5 days a year that SF is hot and they were busy; if I was cooking in a teeny taqueria in the heat, I would appreciate a beer too.
author: Dakota L.

description: Delicious and cheap. They know what they're doing with a burrito and taco. I recommend it for a quick lunch or late night snack.
author: Nick L.

description: I'd like to know what they do with their meat, and I'd like every other taqueria to do that.  Let's call it what it is--this is a taqueria.  No ambiance, no service with a smile (friendly though, just not effusive) just good ass tacos and burritos and such.  Great, signature hot sauce.  It was no this good when I lived in this neighborhood years ago.
author: Ian S.

description: I got the pastor which was good but it wasn't amazing. I have found there to be much better mexican cooking in the city. The habanero salsa is definitely recommended if you do in fact find yourself there.
author: Drew W.

description:
This place is awesome, what I've noticed is that most people who arrive here for the first time don't know how to order. Let me break it down to help facilitate a positive eating experience at the OT.

A) Go all the way to the back to order, do not stand in front of the cash register (that comes later)
B) Break down your order in simple terms, like this... 
    1. Ola! Can I get 2 super burritos.... (Wait for acknowledgment) 
    2. I need 1 chicken & 1 steak.... (Wait for acknowledgment)
C) Now you must refrain from over doing your order with toppings and just wait for the meat to sizzle on the grill. 
D) Select the topping for each burrito separately
E) Proceed to the cash register and pay.

My personal favorite is the carne asada super burrito with salsa, guacamole, pinto beans & hot sauce. 
 
PS I have never seen them with their shirts off and I hope I never do.
author: matt l.

description: A truly great burrito. In the last two weeks, three truly great burritos. Ran into this place with my mom the other week and have gone back several times with friends since. I would recommend the grilled chicken with veggies or the fish burrito.  A friend loved the spicy, marinated chicken one as well.  Super friendly cooks, awesome meat options, and two amazing salsas. A pretty awkward walkway/entrance to the back where you order and an overall freezing temperature, but cool wall decor and of course food. Ask for the hot salsa and you won't even notice how cold you are.
author: Zoey S.

description:
Do your self a favor, never ever ever ever ever ever ever ever ever go here.

Let me start by saying, I've been going to the original location since it opened, about 5 years ago. I know the owner, and pretty much the whole staff at the other place. I lived near by and went to SFSU which is down the street.

Anyways, I went to the Divisadero location and I ordered a regular burrito, and he asked again if i wanted cheese, I said no. The guy who filled the condiments and ran the register was taking his sweet time filling our order.

I get to the register and was paying for both my friend and my burrito. The rings mine up as a super burrito. I mention to him I ordered a regular and didn't ask for cheese, guacamole, or sour cream. 

He gave me a smug look, put the burrito behind him on the counter, and then went to fill other people's order.

At this point I was confused, the guy never said anything to me, or tried to talk to me. He mentioned something to the cook and then ignored me. I couldn't believe it, eventually I sat down with my friend as he ate his burrito. I think/hope they will remake it because I paid for both at that point, but didn't have my food.

Finally after taking 4 people's order, waiting about another 10 minutes, I am extremely starving at this point. They remake the burrito and call me over to get it, but never asked me exactly what I wanted. 

Obviously at this point, I'm pretty irritated, so I quickly rip the burrito in half to check what they put in it. They forgot onions and peppers, spicy sauce, and habanero. I go over and ask the cook and try to talk to him, he shrugs and doesn't say much, but the guy who ran the register/condiments, calls me a "Puta", grabs my plate and pushes the burrito off into the trash. Then walks over to the register and starts pulling money out and puts it out on the counter. 

Once I got the money back, before I did anything I'd regret, I told my friend lets go, and got a burrito next door. 

I'm always one to give a place a second or third chance, but the previous times I've gone, they don't make the burritos correctly as the original location does. This was the last straw, I'm never going here ever again, and when I make it down to the original place, I'm going to let them know what happened.
author: Deepak J.

description:
Ghetto - Check.
Dive - Check.
A little scary - Check.

Hey, I'm not saying I wasn't warned about this place as we were walking in but nothing was really going to prepare me for the ghetto-fabulous-ness of this place.

I had a chicken super burrito with no beans which was super cheesy and delicious.  From what I hear, you gotta make it a super burrito.

Easy to order, basic menu, customize as you please.  Me likey!
author: Derek B.

description:
My 5-star rating is based on the assumption that Taqueria's should be rated on their product (they're not suppose to be rated like other restaurants).  Taqueria = Burrito/Taco factory   

I see most of these reviews are either coming from veterans or new-comers, which explains why the reviews are so extreme.  Let me go over some fun OT facts:

This is Ocean Taqueria #2 (OT #1 is on Ocean ave - hence, "Ocean" Taqueria)  The third taqueria owned by Chino is called "Chinos Taqueria" on Balboa.  All three taquerias make fresh guacamole, pico de gallo, and sauces on the spot.  Chino buys fresh meat several times a week, and proudly displays the meat & produce invoices at the cash register of OT #1 (on Ocean, remember!?)

I love this place!  OT serves the best burritos in San Francisco!  If your looking for a nice, common-sense, professionally run business - this is not the place.  If your looking for the best burrito $6 bucks can buy - the search is over!
author: Anthony B.

description:
Came to this joint because my favorite taqueria next door, Burrito Express, was closed (booooooooo).  Why are so many places closed on Sundays? I just don't get that.

Anywho, it turned out okay because Ocean Taq was awesome! I had the Super Burrito with carnitas. It came stuffed to the brim with: rice, refried beans, cheese, guacamole, salsa and sour cream (which I opted out of). It was finger lickin' goodness. Also noteworthy were the chips and salsa which were fab.
author: Julia N.

description:
They definitely don't have the Feng Shui going here.  

Weird setup, friendly folks, but the carne asada was kind of odd.  I don't know - when I crave a burrito, I go to Gordo or Pancho Villa.  If someone held a gun to my head and said "eat an Ocean burrito or die", I wouldn't hesitate to eat a burrito.  But as a free man in a plentiful city, it's not my first choice.
author: Louis M.

description: This place is great. Just be careful with the orange hot sauce! It could kill ya!
author: M R.

description:
Can I help you, amigo?  That's usually the greeting you get when you go into this place.  It feels like one of those hidden mission burrito joints that makes awesome 3 AM burritos... except you're in the lower pac heights and it's noon.

Man, it's nice to know I love the taste of burritos when I'm sober too.

Nice portions, and the choice of getting a 'baby' burrito (a little smaller/cheaper) has probably saved me a few miles on the treadmill.  The lunch plates are popular too... you can get your favorite meat in your favorite sauce with all the fixins.  Price is decent too and the guys here are really friendly.
author: Neej M.

description:
It is fast, it is dirty, it is good.

Not the best burrito I have had, but definitely not the worst either.   They pump out carne asada burritos in a flash and it is close to home.  The only drawback is the lack of parking, but then again, we live in San Francisco.
author: Jason G.

description:
Best Burritos. I used to love Cancun out near 30th street-- but after getting knuckles and gristle in my burrito one night... I looked closer to home for my fix.

They grill the meat fresh and they'll make your selection any way your wish. The staff is nice, and they always remember my husband and I when we come in.  I really like that they have an area to dine in at, so you can sit and chat a while.

I've taken most of my friends that are visiting to this place-- and they  LOVED it. Even some with the most sophisticated palettes enjoyed the burritos. 

Minus one star, because they're not open later :[

Thanks to  Matt L. for laying out the ordering process in your yelp review-- it helped the newbies keep the place efficient.
author: maranda w.

description: Almost Mayberry friendly and with the best horchata in the city. A bit cramped and somewhat chaotic, but these are the places with true character. It is why we avoid Applebee's and such.
author: George S.

description:
I live a couple of blocks away and eat here often, and there is nothing really to complain about.  Are there better taqueria's in San Francisco?  Sure, but they aren't two blocks from my house.

I enjoy the made to order approach (as in, "I'll have carne asada."  and then they pull out some raw beef and throw it on the grill) and the Jumbo is unreal (a burrito that is made with two tortillas, yeah).

I could do without the soggy lettuce.
author: Vince T.

description:
Some major burrito faux pas here:

- Too expensive. 7$ for a big burrito.
- No flour tortillas for the big burritos. I had to get a spinach tortilla. Um... this is San Francisco! I thought tortillas fell from the sky here!
- Chicken grilled to order. Never seen that one before. Should be in a big container, stewing in some tasty juices. Makes me think the turnover isn't high enough. 
- SLLOOOWWWW.... good lord, I have never waited that long for a burrito in my entire life. Even the long lines at Anna's Taqueria in Boston move faster than that. 

The actual taste of the burrito wasn't half bad but I was really thrown by the spinach tortilla.
author: Scott T.

description:
I do not understand why anyone would ever go here when El Burrito is on the same block.  Granted Ocean Taqueria is open later, the food sucks.  Seriously beware of what you order, and try not to think of how long that chicken or beef has been sitting in that pot.  My brave roommate actually got sick from the food here.  And if you bother to check their health inspection ratings, you will find that they scored a whopping 55 out of a possible 100 points.

And to top it all off, they are sure to serve up a nice helping of attitude with every taco.
author: Dubs W.

description:
Admitting, I only walked in this place because... 

1. The Cheese-steak shop down the street was packed
2. I wanted something fast without waiting too long
3. Most important, my phone was dying, and they had free outlets, so I could charge it while enjoying some eats!

Just before 9:00pm on a Friday night, I'm in this long ass walk-in closet/hallway of a restaurant 5 mins before figuring out you have to order from the back, then work your way to the front. There's only ONE guy ahead of me!!! Yet it takes 8 mins before getting around to my order. I guess the other guy was on break or some shit because he's just chillin' by the register watching WWE wrestling with his 11yr. old.  The whole time, there's kids screaming and running throughout the place, and a woman (I guess one of the employees) keeps walking in/out every other minute like she's waiting for a ride, and leaving her kids behind...wtf??! 

Once my Quesadilla gets around to being made, the muthafucker isn't even cut! Just one HUGE soft taco or something. So I give this guy the "Problem Eyes," like, "Amigo, is this a self-serve restaurant? what's up with this, it doesn't come sliced?" Then he gives me this bullshit reaction like "Oh, I didn't know you wanted it cut"

*SLAP right across his face in his grill, oh I wish haha

So he gives me back this sloppy ass quesadilla with shit spewing out the sides of it...ugh!

I warned you
author: Tekk A.

description:
I've had Mexican food probably ever week since I was born. 

Ocean Taqueria is amazing. 

The proportions are huge and the food is very fresh. I don't understand what all you haters are talking about because this Taqueria is really fresh and affordable. The guys making the food do a great job and you won't leave without a Spanish lesson. 

This is authentic Mexican food so if you don't like real Mexican food you should go to tortilla heights down the street and have Americans cook your tacos. 

try the chicken fajita burrito.

ps. the last time I was hear they asked if I wanted a side of tequila.
author: Shel Z.

description:
Do you want a 14-inch long burrito? You came to the right place. 

The first time I came here, I wanted to turn around and walk back out. It seems shady with the ordering station ALL the way in the back and the handwritten (Sharpie on cardboard) menu on the wall. But my friends assured me it was legit. The food was AMAZING, the enchiladas were super and the burritos were fantastic. The fresh ingredients and meats are prepared right in front of you. They don't take credit card though, CASH ONLY. The next time I'm in the area, I'll definitely go again.
author: Rachele S.

description:
Its good for what it is....Meats at least cooked in front of you with the tortilla sitting on the grill letting the cheese melt.  Then said ingredients come together with the requisite rice and beans (which were the low points), sour cream, guac, lettuce, and the salsa fresca and super spicy red sauce.  
If I was drunk the stars would have gone up to four, but for sober snacking it was middle of the road.  I feel like I should go to the original to really give this place a fair review, but that will have to wait for my next trip.
And for all those calling this ghetto, you must really not have been to many ghettos; I found it quite alright.
author: Sheila Y.

description: For some reason that I can't quite articulate, this is the best burrito in San Francisco! Very unique flavor.
author: Amy S.

description:
Ocean  was one of the few places to get a decent burrito on this side of town. 

That is until they raised their prices about 35% per item in one fell swoop a couple of weeks back. 

Call me cheap, but I just can't rationalize paying 7 bucks for a mediocre burrito.
author: Jason R.

description:
Great little hole in the wall burrito place (esp in Pac Heights) 
I had the fajita burrito and everything was grilled right there in front of me- so you know its fresh! 
I would totally go back-just dont be scared by appearances.
author: Janae L.

description:
I'm very disappointed in this place.  I used to eat at the Ocean Taqueria on Ocean Ave back in college all of the time.  I was delighted to find a new location by my new apartment in the West Add.. However, it seems this location has a major problem with cleanliness.  The SF Dept. of Health gave this place a 55/100 in their last inspection.  Needless to say, the third time I hit this new location, I became painfully ill just minutes after finishing.  The ill feeling stuck around for a couple of days.  :(  

I haven't returned, and sadly, probably never will.  I'd still recommend their other location, but this one needs to clean up it's act.

BTW here's the link for the dept. of health:

http://www.dph.sf.ca.us/eh/Violations/Loc_CurrentViol.asp?LocationID=629
author: Jonathan K.

description:
One of my favorite Taquerias in San Francisco. Luckily I have gotten to grow up in SF and experience a lot of different taquerias and mexican food restaurants. Ocean Taqueria is easily in my top 3 and I make it a point to always take my out of town friends here to experience a real burrito. I went to High School 3 blocks from here and it was a weekly routine to make the journey to Ocean for lunch. Whether it was the tacos or the burritos, I always left satisfied. My favorite thing on the menu is the Grilled Chicken super burrito. They grill the chicken right in front of you, guaranteeing its freshness. Their guacamole is incredible as well and if you dare, try a spicy pepper or two, they are well worth the pain!
The Staff is incredibly nice and while they almost only speak spanish, if you can speak some of the language they will love you for trying. They have given myself and my friends great deals over the years due to being such great customers and you can tell they really appreciate their customers. After leaving San Francisco for college and coming back 2 years later, the staff immediately remembered me and gave me a warm welcoming, chatting me up about live at school. 
Over all I love this place and while it looks like a bit of a hole in the wall, its food more than speaks for itself and my friends and I always come hungry, and leave in pure bliss.
author: Colin T.

description: A nice shop to visit close by UCSF Mt Zion. Portion sizes are big. I didn't appreciate the microwaved nacho cheese (throw cheese on chips, then stuff in microwave). Otherwise, the food was good, including the fish plate that we ordered. I'd come back, though not for the nachos!
author: Eric C.

description: Outstanding fish tacos.  There are many little taquerias in this part of SF, so I can't compare one against another.  However, one of my son's college friends gave this one an endorsement, and I must echo the advice:  if you're near the park and museums and looking for a quality meal, this is your place!
author: Matt C.

description:
Weird set up at this place. It's a long narrow restaurant where you have to walk all the way to the back to order your food. On the way, there's a few tables and shabby interior design. When you get to the ordering station, the dim lights overhead help to disguise the meager offerings of your standard Mexican fare. When I went in at lunch hour, the beans and other condiments in the steam table were down to half and judging by the crusty line of dried goop on the sides of the containers, I assumed the food had just been put away the night before and pulled out for service that day, without refilling.

I continued to order a beef burrito. When the cook rolled it up, it was small. The smallest burrito I have ever had in San Francisco. I think I even had a bigger burrito at Taco Bell! When I asked for chips, the cashier said it was extra. Well fine, I'll pay 50 cents for chips. Then I asked for some hot sauce or salsa for the chips. He gave me an embarrassed look as if to say the salsa was going to cost me more too. Luckily, he caught the hint and threw in the salsa for free. 

The burrito lacked flavor. Plus, I was paranoid that I'd catch something or get sick from the unappetizing ingredients. 

In this town, to compete with the dozens of other taquerias you'd better cook up a nice fat burrito that's fresh and satisfies a lunch craving, not just a kid's sized burrito for a snack. And that interior is SCARY, needs some changes for sure.
author: Foodie F.

description:
I can not say enough good things about Ocean Taqueria!  I work close-by and it's the perfect place to go to have a relaxing lunch.  The food is always fresh and delicious and the portions are huge.  No matter what I get I always end up needing a to-go box. 

I usually get either a super burrito or super tacos with carnitas.  Again, always delicious!  The guys who work there are also WONDERFUL!  They are super nice and I don't even go in there all that often but they always remember me and hook me up with free extras.  The prices are very reasonable too and it's so convenient that they accept credit cards.  Yesterday I had two super tacos and a beer and it was ten bucks.  

Try eating AND drinking for ten bucks anywhere else in this neighborhood...except maybe the cheese steak place....

I agree that it's sort of awkward to know where the line ends the first time you go there, but it's a taqueria, look for the tortillas, walk towards them, stand behind the last person.  Ask someone if you have to, they won't bite!  It's not that hard...
author: Rachael C.

description: I wasn't too impressed with this restaurant.  While it's nice that they cook your food when you order and you get to choose what you want in it, they overcooked the chicken in my chicken burrito to a point that it was crispy black going into my tortilla.  Boy was I in for a surprise when I took my first bite!  I should have ordered my cancer burrito to go, because we were never served the water that we had asked for.  Unless you like bad service and overcooked food, I'd go to El Burrito Express instead.
author: Karen W.

description: Best place in the city I take a hour bus ride just to go whenever I want a burrito
author: Greg L.

description: Fantastic! Wish I loved closer so that I could eat here every day. Veggie friendly, good prices.
author: Christy C.

description:
We were walking towards my boyfriend's apartment on a Tuesday night hoping to make it to El Burrito Express before they closed but as we stepped in front of the door, they closed up the shop for the night.  Noooooooooooo!  Okay, regroup...what are we going to get now?

There's Godzilla sushi or the other burrito place that we rarely go to.  

Well, the last 3 times we've gone to Godzilla for take-out they told us our 4 teka & cali rolls would take 45 mins so that's a no go (what takes them so long anyways, the restaurant wasn't even full).  Fine, we'll give that other burrito place a shot.

Well let me tell you, the nachos with chili verde (hold the sour cream, please) did not disappoint.  There were plenty of goodies atop the chips and it was a pretty decent meal for the two of us.  I highly recommend them!
author: Krystle S.

description: This is the burrito spot of Pacific heights..el burrito next door is good but this is the spot...definitely an authentic taqueria. Insane shrimp burrito. Trust me this is your place for a burrito fix
author: Christian S.

description:
While not as mind blowing as (what I assume is the) original Ocean Taqueria (on Ocean).  This place is still leaps and bounds above the quality of most taquerias. What I really appreciated is that they cook the meat for you fresh, with the addition of onions and peppers if you want them.  The burritos are made to order in front of you (think subway sandwich) and prepared relatively fast.

The ambiance isn't much but this area is in a void of great food so if you are here often and want some great food, check it out.
author: Thadd L.

description: Bomb-ass mexican food in lower pac hts.  I've been on a quest to find a great mexican place near my house (inner rich) since I moved.  so far this is the closest one that reaches my high mexican food standard.
author: Sage S.

description:
Ocean Taqueria #2 you say? Well it is certainly nothing like #1. 

I live a couple blocks away from Ocean Ave so I eat at Ocean Taq all the time. It's pretty darn good, the carne asada is just bomb. Everything is good. And then my friend lives near Ocean Taq #2. So we ate there once. Nasty. The beans were soggy and tasted like they came from a can at Safeway. The carne asada looked old and certainly did not taste any newer than it looked. The whole burrito was just kinda sloppy and bland. If I'm in that neighborhood, I'll stick to El Burrito if I'm close by again. And if I'm not, I'll stick to my #1 burrito place, Ocean Taq #1.
author: Samuel K.

description:
I regret to say that i joined Yelp just to give this place a review.  I ate here today since El Burrito Express 2 is closed on Sundays. Ocean Taqueria is always open and no one is ever there. I should have known better.

My boyfriend and I ordered 3 tacos, which seemed to be a bother for the two employees behind the counter. As one employee handled the tacos, we watched the cashier chop shrimp, take our money, give us our change and return to the shrimp. He didn't wash his hands or remove his gloves between any of that. As he rang us up, he asked why my boyfriend didn't speak any Spanish.  Direct translation: "Why don't you speak Spanish, boy?".  I repeat. We were the only customers there. Poor retention tactic.

I ate the sub par taco and a few stale chips out of desperation and against my better judgment.  Eight hours later, both of us feel sick. I don't know if Ocean Taqueria has anything to do with it; but I will be sure to just go home when El Burrito Express 2 isn't open.
author: Kira F.

description:
Fast, cheap, good and down the block from my beloved Fishbowl, I can't go wrong with Ocean Taqueria. The baby burrito is the perfect amount of food for someone my size, as I can never ever finish a whole regular sized burrito. 

The dining area is pretty dingy. I'd take it to go, either to the Fishbowl or just a walk around the block
author: Kelly C.

description:
Although the menu scribbled on the wall several times down the long hallway was confusing (I kept thinking there must be something different on many versions--there isn't), the super chicken taco I ended up ordering was very good.

For $3.50, a giant plate of super taco gets three stars.  It's not my favorite taqueria, but I'd happily go back.
author: Katie S.

description:
I love Ocean Tac. They're food can be delicious. The habanero hot sauce ... incredible. They cook the meats in front of you (in some cases). All good stuff really.

Their problem: Bad beans, and inconsistent.

Some days, my burrito comes out HUGE (which is good news). Other days, it's a skimpy little baby burrito (despite ordering a super). The beans.. I won't even get into the beans.
author: Zed C.

description:
When I first moved to SF, I didn't have a job and spent my days putting together Ikea furniture and searching CL for new job postings.
During my carpentry breaks, I'd explore my neighborhood.  My first or second day, I came across Ocean.  

Good burritos and nice staff. The baby burritos are pretty cheap, imo  I haven't been back in a while, since I actually have a life now, but I'd say it's a decent burrito for the 'hood... better than Tortilla Heights
author: Hannah F.

description:
At my age, I really appreciated how the dudes in there were calling me "Chica" when it is obvious that I am a "Senora"

Anyway, this place has pretty good burritos.  I don't care what other people say, I can deal with the set-up.  Not every burrito place has perfect Feng Shui. 

Four stars because you do have to wait a little longer than normal because they grill orders individually.
author: Sue U.

description: not impressed with my tacos in any way though my companions loved their fish burritos.
author: Wakako U.

description: One of my favorite Mexican places to eat. I usually get the super burrito, quesadilla, or tacos with carne asada. I like how you can see them make your order right there although it is a tight space in the back of the restaurant. You can pretty much customize your order any way you like it. I really enjoy their carne asada. Nice sear on the outside and tasty all over. It's a shame I don't live in SF anymore but when I do go to SF and have a craving for a burrito, I definitely stop by here.
author: Randy T.

description: Good, cheap mexican food.  Had the super burrito, fully loaded, with chile verde, pretty damn good for 6 bucks.  Not dirty or grimey, just cheap and decent.  I'll go back when I'm starving and don't wanna spend a buncha coin.
author: Ryan H.

description:
When I lived in the Presidio, this was my spot for burritos (Los Ermanos on Chestnut is just so bland...). 

Carne Asada is the best. They cook the meat when you order, so t's not sitting there all day drying out. 

I love when you're eating it and you get towards the bottom where all of the hot liquid and grease has collected from the meat, salsa and beans!! Those last 4-5 bites are the best!!!!
author: John D.

description: I've walked by this place a few times and decided to try it out.  It's hard because there are 2 other Mexican restaurants nearby so I imagine having killer fare is what keeps people coming.  I liked the layout of the restaurant when I walked in.  You have to walk all the way to the back of the restaurant and it's very narrow.  The menu is written (poorly, albeit) on a huge piece of cardboard that is taped to the wall.  The 2 men behind the counter were very nice and chatted with me while they cooked my food.  I ordered the Chile Verde burrito and was pleased with it.  Not the best burrito in SF but it's cheap, huge and quick.  I'd come back again to try their seafood and hang out with their friendly crew.
author: Carmel U.

description:
Surprisingly good.  Went down here after El Burrito Express was so sadly closed at 10:30AM when I had burrito cravings.  

I liked the fresh cooked meats in front of me - not sure why these other reviewers don't like such a thing.  I'd prefer fresh cooked chicken to chicken from a vat any day.  The carnitas were good too - they were careful to pick the chunks of fat out before shredding the meat.

Overall good burritos close to home.
author: Rob K.

description:
Pretty decent burrito if you care about your arteries and stomach and are therefore avoiding the grease party next door at el burrito express. They make it in front of you like good taqueristas should, and will try to speak Spanish to you no matter who you are. 

I just made up 'taqueristas'. I hope you like it. I hope you use it later, and attribute it to me.
author: Shannon V.

description:
This place has the best vegetarian burritos within walking distance from my apartment.

They put lots of fresh vegetables on their burrito, and use an almost perfect ratio of beans, rice, lettuce, tomato, salsa, guacamole.

i also love the decor - fast, clean, simple.  their ventilation system works too, so i don't leave smelling like al pastor.

The bad: portions are a bit stingy, and i wish it stayed open later.  regardless, it gets 5 stars.
author: Dustin E.

description:
Best burrito I've had in this part of town.  The special habanero salsa gives this place the kick that puts it over the top.  With a strip of other burrito/taco options within two blocks, this hole in the wall is a must-try.  The place is run down and easy to miss, but the food makes it worth the stop.  

Everything I've had here is great, the only reason it lost a star is that the day cook has a bad attitude.  I won't eat here during the day because this guy won't listen to you and gets upset when you want your food as you ordered it.  The night cook is much better and he makes the burritos with a generous helping of meat and guac (who doesn't want that).  Don't order the habanero sauce unless you really can handle spicy, ask for a taste if you're unsure.

Overall, a great place to get a burrito and beer to go.  You can eat in, but don't be surprised that the interior quality is far from that of the food.
author: Thomas J.

description:
This review should be for the Taqueria on Ocean Ave...but since i can't find that one, i'll write it here.  There's burritos are tasty, juicy and really one of the best.  Prices are good, they have risen but not too bad.  You can get a Jumbo burrito for like 7.50 and this includes overlapping two big flour tortillas to make a GIGANTIC burrito.  The people are usually nice.  
Here's one thing I noticed, when the owners there making your burrito, it's not as big =(.  
I like to get the grilled items.  Like carne asada or chicken.  Ask for onions and bell peppers and they'll grill it too.  

Try their strawberry fresca.
author: Leena C.

description:
This place has fantastic enchiladas!  There are times when I'm just craving good, quick Mexican food, and THIS, my friends, is the spot.  I was born in Mexico, studied abroad there for 2+ years, so I know good Mexican food.  This place comes really close to the real deal down yonder.

Is it a hole in the wall?-- yes.  Is the menu written with marker on cardboard?-- YUP!.  This is not the place to bring a date or to even sit down to eat (though there's room for it and I've certainly done it) but the food rocks.
author: Sara W.

description: Subway's foot long ain't got ish on this! Ocean Taqueria is the home of the infamous 14 inch burrito! The best part of this is that you can get the 14 in half and half, so you're really getting more for your money, which is BI-WINNING! And if you're lucky enough to get it here during Cinco De Mayo, they will give you shots on top of your order which is HUGE for me! Is this the best burrito in SF? no. But is it for the people? I say HELL YES!
author: Matthew L.

description:
Tasty!!!
I suggest getting the grilled chicked with bell peppers and onions. They grill the meat in front of you and then add the peppers and onions and something that looked like butter garlic. My burrito came out perfectly garlicky and even tastier with every bite.
author: stash e.

description: Wow, for being a taqueria, you should be able to make a grubbin' taco.  Not the case here.  I just had the most bland, dry, tasteless "spicy" taco.  It was barely edible. I would avoid.
author: D B.

description: Chill little place nearby Fish Bowl and other bars on Divis. The burritos and quesadillas were super good. I'd definitely check it out again next time I'm in the area.
author: Lou T.

description: Somebody actually said they had the best burrito in San Francisco here??? Wow, that person must be running a high fever or maybe is on some seriously heavy drugs!! There is no way this place has the best burrito in SF!! Save your money and walk down the street to El Burrito Express. This place has way better food. Sometimes all restaurants have a bad day, but in this case I don't think this taqueria has great days. I had a carne asada burrito with everything on it. It was o.k., definitely edible , but definitely not tasty or even great. The burrito was just "eh" and so so. The interior is shabby and beat up, so beware. It looks like it is in decline. I can't see the person who wrote that this place had the best burrito in San Francisco as any person that has their taste buds working properly. No offense Ocean Taqueria, but I am never going back here.
author: Tony M.

description:
If you know what you like this place is amazing. To be honest, I don't really remember if anything was different about the place when i first started going there but I've been going to this Ocean Taq for years and the guys there know me and hand me an incredible burrito every time. Another thing I really appreciate is how efficient they are. At lunch time they may have 20 people in line and you can get up there ordering in no time! But as always, you can call in your order for a really quick pickup.

If you're up for fun, speak Spanish to the guys there (specifically the guy working the register) and you'll be sure to have an awesome time. They crack jokes like none other!
author: Alex T.

description:
Originally was an EBX devotee but they're closed on Sundays and the staff has never been super friendly to me after my efforts of trying to become a regular.  

Went to Ocean Taqueria and was very impressed.  It's cool enough getting to watch them mass cook and take orders while making it look too easy.  The food is cheap and I haven't had a bad experience (or a messed up order) yet.  Only bummer is the chips and salsa aren't free but I highly doubt there expensive.  They do serve alcohol and accept credit cards which is always an unknown if you haven't yelped or anything else.  

What's better, their Giants fans and they remember you-- or sure make it feel like they do, either of which I'll take.

Definitely worth a try if you're looking a cheap, quick bite.
author: Erin C.

description: This place is great.  quality meats well cooked, good veggies tehy grill with it, soft torillas.  It is old school hole in the wall where you stand in line with tables to sit but the cooks are firendly and customize the orders and are quick.  Freshly grilled meat is key.
author: Lane S.

description: I like this place. The food is legit. .....They make some awesome nachos and burritos. Decent beer selection and it is fairly inexpensive. You get options here at Ocean, and you can decide on the spot what you want.....So you can look at everything and just pick what looks good to you.....Service here does there job and the food comes out the way you ask for it and warm.
author: joe c.

description:
I ordered the pollo rojo buritto, side of rice, chips and salsa.

The pollo rojo was unseasoned, the salsa watery & pretty much void of any taste.

The rice was great.

I will go back when intoxicated.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Oh please, this place isn't ghetto.  It's sandwiched between Godzila sushi and the Fishbowl.  People who think this shop is ghetto really need to try eating burritos in the Mission.
It's a bit tricky to order when it's crowded though as the layout is bizarre.  You have to walk through the dining area, way back down a narrow hallway toward the bathrooms to get in line.  But the hallway is where you scoot along, directing the guy who is loading up your burrito with the fillings of your choice.  So you have to squeeze past all these hungry burrito eaters to wait your turn to block the hallway while you shout out one second too late, "NO RICE!  Aw, that's okay.  Sorry for yelling."
The staff is always very nice to me, and they tolerate me when I speak Spanish and then look at them blankly when they respond to me in kind.  
However, they're my second choice for burritos on Divis, even if they are nicer.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
"Ten thirty one, por favor."
"Huh? Oh, no - I just ordered a burrito."
 "Si, ten thirty one."
 "The burrito is $10.31?"
 "Si."
I'm sorry but what????? Since when did a taqueria burrito cost $10.31? I could have gone to Whole Foods and gotten a gourmet burrito for less than that. These Ocean Taqueria Burritos must be good if they are charging that much for them. Oh, but to my surprise - the burrito was simply eh. They grilled it fresh. Nice. They gave me the wrong tortilla. Not nice. The guy making my burrito obliged me when I said I only wanted a little rice. Nice. He seemed to think I wanted only a little of everything else also because the burrito was SMALL! Not nice. The guy behind the register wasn't cooking anything but was wearing a chef's hat that had pickles wearing santa hats on it. Nice. He did not offer me complimentary chips but instead shoved a handful of peppermints in my bag. Not nice. I am polite and wish the staff a good day and walk back to work to enjoy my lunch. Good thing I wasn't very hungry because I finished the whole thing in about five bites. The burrito was seriously lacking flavor. I wanted to put salt on it but I thought that would just be so wrong. Again the grilled shrimp with peppers and onions were a nice fresh touch but they needed to have been seasoned. 
 I doubt that I will be visiting Ocean Taqueria anytime soon. I'll give them two stars because I hated it less than I hated getting stung by a bee and the pickles wearing santa hats hat made me laugh. 

Oh, and p.s. - with all the money they are charging for food, they should be able to afford a real menu board as opposed to the big piece of plywood nailed to the wall with the menu options written on it in Sharpie.
author: Nuvia C.

description:
i agree with what deepak said.
the guys who work here are absolute jerks.
i was very surprised at the amount of attitude i got, considering no one else was in the joint.

went in asking if they were closed; they said no...
ordered a burrito and i asked for some salsa on the side- groaning ensued.

as i was waiting i asked "when do you close"?
they were like "every night, amigo... every night".
?

and i said "what time"?
they say "oh!  you want to know what TIME, do you"?

i didn't have cash, but they had a card machine- instead of ringing it up with a receipt (their printer was out of ink), they wrote one out and sarcastically told me "thank you soooo much for your business... we'll see you tomorrow".  

i mean, wtf!?  how hard is it to either tell someone that you're closed or not give them a bunch of bulls**t?

come on people; get it together.
if you knew how to make good food, you wouldn't make assumptions about people's character and have such a sorry attitude about life.
author: linden d.

description: I used to love this place until last week when I got food poisoning from their veggie nachos. It was either the cheese or the guacamole, something wasn't right. It was always a ginormous amount of food for a decent price but I won't be going back.
author: kristin v.

description:
When you live in the area of Pacific Heighs that I do, your two closest choices for burritos are Nick's Crispy Taco's to the east or La Salsa to the west... one is garbage the other is the Carl's Jr. of Mexican food (and is owned by the same company).  I could head north and grab some "Mexican" food at Left at Albuquerque's but today I was craving an authentic burrito at a place without pictures adorning a shiny plastic menu.

The closest places I could find were Ocean Taqueria and El Burrito Express, not 3 doors away from each other on the same block of Divisadero.  On a side note, apparently there's an unspoken ban on authentic Mexican food between (but not including) Divisadero and Polk St.... much to my dismay.  

After eyeballing El Burrito and Ocean, I figured Ocean was more authentic and headed in.  Hearing far more Spanish being spoken than English, I was already satisfied with its authenticity.  The menu was written with black magic marker on a plain white wall... perfect!  I ordered my burrito and was able to select my ingredients while the chef was making it (a la Freebirds).  I love places like this for two reasons:

1) You make sure you get what you want
2) As soon as you're done ordering, the burrito is ready

I quickly paid for my burrito (not super cheap, but very moderately priced) and sat down to enjoy.  Here's where I'll stop blowing sunshine up the ass of this Taqueria.  The burrito was good, and I'll definitely come back for another, but not the best I've ever had.  I like a fairly healthy burrito (no sour cream, cheese, guac, etc), but I also like a lot of flavor; again, it was good, but not great.

Anyway, I gave this place 4 stars, partly due to my craving of the day, partly due to the authenticity and partly due to the scarcity of such a burrito place near my house.  If there were a dozen burrito joints near my place and this was just one of them, this would get 3 stars.

Bottom line - I was glad I made the trip and will definitely come back.
author: Pete S.

description: Not digging it.  This place is so flippin' mediocre.  Never been to the location on Ocean, so maybe that one's better.  Not much else to say.  Maybe that I could get a better burrito in Wyoming, not that I've ever had a burrito in Wyoming.
author: Leon R.

description:
so I've only lived in the city about six months and I'm trying to get to as many new places to eat as I can. I was brought to the ocean taq on ocean street in my first month and had well basically the best asada burrito I've ever eaten. Fast forward another month and I found this ocean on Divis. The burrito here tasted exactly the same! 

The 5 star rating here is definitely  for the food, All taquerias are crap holes on the inside and if its not then its really just a chain business owned place attempting to capture that "south of the border charm." I almost never eat in them anyway. So lets get to the food. How it works has been described pretty well here.  I love that they grill the meat right in front of you. You know it hasn't been pre-cooked, boiled in a bag and shoved under a heat lamp all day. They have a huge selection of tortillas and the way you get to pick everything you want in the burrito as its being constructed is genius.  One word of caution if you get everything including the hot sauce the burrito will be very liquidy and run down your arm. I usually skip the hot sauce or have them put very little on.  The super is the burrito to get, if you get a baby and start adding items that it doesn't come with, your charged for them and might as well have gotten the super anyway. The nachos are also the best I've had, everything that goes in the burrito goes on top of the chips after the cheese gets melted on. The prices are a little spendy (for a taqueria) but I think its worth it. I shouldn't be eating burritos all the time anyway. The staff are always very friendly however if you try to go there in the hour before closing you might get greeted with a locked door or them telling you they are already closed so don't always count on a quick late night run there.
author: Chris D.

description: i just got home from a cross country road trip over the last two weeks. In the spirit of Cinco De Mayo i thought I'd hit up some Mexican food. I've learned that in the south...the Mexican food sucks! SO, right when i got home i was on the quest for some delicious Mexican food...i found it at Ocean Taqueria!! it was the authentic, yummy goodness that i was looking for. Since it's right down the street from my house i have been there twice since i discovered it last week. It may not look too inviting from the outside (or the inside really) which is why I've probably passed it by before, but if it's good food your looking for and you don't feel like making the trek to the mission...this is the best!
author: Jayla B.

description: My go to Mexican place.  The staff is friendly, always calling me "Amigo"  The quesadillas are the best I have ever had.  The decor is mas or minus, but who cares when you are picking up a burrito or a quesadilla.  They also have dinner plates that are good as well.  If you you are looking for a quick bite to eat in lower pacific heights, this is where you should go.  It is also very cheap.  I highly recommend it.
author: David C.

description: Meh.  It's aight I guess.  If you like burritos, go next door to burrito express.  If you like tacos, go to LA. (Haha, it's just sort of a burito town, with the exception of going to the Mission.  There are a lot of great options in the Mission.)
author: Raman R.

description: I've been craving burritos lately for a post-workout meal, so I made my way into El Burrito Express a few doors down where I had stumbled into a lil kids birthday party.  After staring at the menu for a good minute, I was informed that they were closed.  I embarrassingly walked out, still in search of a burrito, when I came upon Ocean Taqueria (Numero Dos).  The food is prepared in front of you, towards the rear of the restaurant, with the dining area by the door.  The burrito itself was mediocre.  Prices are spot on.  I'll have to see how nearby El Burrito compares.
author: Marsha Z.

description: I really wasn't feeling this taqueria. My carnitas burrito was just ok. You have to pay $2 for chips. Besides the chips it's fairly cheap and beers are only $3 but I still think there are a million better burrito joints.
author: Jackie G.

description: Apparently rich people hate burritos, because the choices in Pacific Heights are pretty damn slim (anyone for La Salsa?). When I don't feel like trekking halfway across town, I'll stick my head into Ocean Taqueria, which in my opinion is a step above El Burrito Express next door. They'll grill your meat while you wait, and the end result is a burrito that ain't half bad.
author: Chris B.

description: The ideal taqueria: divey and inexpensive with tasty burritos. The chips are only so-so but the burritos are delish.
author: Jenny K.

description: It is what it is.  It's fast, relatively cheap, and no frills Mexican fare.  Take a walk down the long, narrow hallway and observe the cafeteria-like display of ingredients.  Open until 10 on weeknights.
author: Tim G.

description: The Ocean is pretty good.  Not great, but definitely good, and far above average.  They grill the meat when you order, so that makes me happy.  All the ingredients did look much fresher than most of the burrito joints in this city of burrito joints.  The ambiance of the place is a little sketchy (e.g. the sharpie/particle board menu), but then again, show me a non-sketchy cheap burrito place.  I'll definitely continue to swim in the ocean.
author: Casey S.

description: This is a great neighborhood place.  Yes, free chips would be nice. The tacos are really good.  Love this place.
author: Zaula D.

description:
oh hell yes.

burritos of all sizes and fillings, made with fresh ingredients. the only thing I'd change would be the consistency of the guacamole and sour cream. everything else is perfect. 

service is friendly. the taqueristas (thanks shannon!) are primarily spanish-speaking, so speak clearly and point if you're not fluent. Your experience will also be more pleasant if you like reggaeton, I guess.

let me make it easy for you: super burrito, grilled chicken, refried beans, spicy (rojo) sauce
author: matthew r.

description: Cheap and skanky. Then again, sometimes I'm in a hurry and I'm in the mood for something like that. The burritos are filling and they are pretty tasty, although I agree with the concerns about the service and the sanitation.
author: p v.

description:
I will start by saying that I really wanted to like this place. A friend recommended it so I thought for sure it would be good. I was wrong, very very wrong... 

The service was HORRIBLE. The guys were super rude. 

So you order at one end and then tell them what you want as you go down the line. They were so skimpy with everything. There was nothing "super" about our burritos. At the end I asked for a little more salsa on each of the 3 burritos because they hadn't put barely any on any of the burritos. The guy added the smallest amount, maybe a tablespoon to each. 

When I went to pay I noticed there was an extra $2.55 in charges and when I asked what it was for he said it was for the extra salsa on the burritos. 85 cents each! I told him the was crazy and that he didn't mention the charge when I asked for a little more salsa. He just stared at me and said "oh well" 

How did the burritos taste? The consensus of our three burritos.... blah! Not worth your money!
author: Yelper S F.

description: So basically myself and six friends walked in and thought "normal burrito joint, hopefully they're good".  The one patron ordered and as his was being prepared by burrito kings every other one of us asked for the same. Ordering in spanish helps, though if they can understand, burrito with everything (with black beans, and I had chicken) is what you should ask for.  I'm salivating.
author: Walter B.

description: If you want a soggy burrito loaded with salty guacamole and other random juices in your burrito then this is your stop.  I always get a stomach ache when I eat here.  I should have a stomach of steel after eating all the dirty chinese places around here.  But for reason the cat meat and other meats rip my flab up.  They have the worst nachos.  They are worse than La Salsa if you can believe it.  Walk two doors down to Burrito Express 2.
author: Fatty A.

description: My burrito was a little bit bland, but they make everything fresh on-site & it's close to my house. It'd be unfair of me to hold it to the same standard I do taquerias in the Mission, & it gets props for being convenient & affordable.
author: Pete J.

description: Way overrated.  I went here to eat after my mock endo board and this place just made my bad day worse.  The burritos here are way overrated.    If you want to go to a dirty place with sub par burritos, this is your place.
author: Christopher D.

description: The burrito is good every time. I always get the pollo asado and the chicken is always cooked to perfection. Its open later than other walk-in places in the area and its definitely better than burrito express (next door).
author: Jenica M.

description: Fairly large selection, nachos, tostadas, and usually one or two "traditional" meats lengua not found in gringo hoods.  The guys who work behind the counter are friendly and patient, and I've gone out of my way to eat here lately.  Not fancy, but they've done a little work on the dining area.
author: Ken B.

description: From what I remember, this was last night and a few sodas were involved, the food was good. I split a carne asada burrito. I remember the establishment being really long a skinny. They serve Budweiser and that was good also.
author: Bryan M.

description: Horrible.  The fact that this has a rating even comparable to Ricos in North Beach is a shame.  My friend took me here, said it was good, I could hardly finish my food.  We went the next day to Ricos and he agreed it was hands down a better meal.  Not even close.
author: Matt L.

description: Hmmm, well I think they have great burritos, it's near my place, and it's cheap.  I've probably been about 10 times.  I love that the chicken is grilled right there, rather than just sittin' around in some sauce in a metal container all day.  Really, that's the "asada" part?  If you want the other, they have that, too.  Great hot sauces.  May be mostly the freshly grilled chicken, possibly also the fresh cilantro, but I think they make a yummy and fairly unique-tasting (difficult thing with a burrito) burrito.  The atmosphere is such that you'd best be gettin' take-out, though.
author: Jes H.

description: I had a dentist appointment this afternoon and my stomach was growling the entire time.  While my dentist cleaned my teeth, I deliberated whether it would be appropriate to ask him to borrow his cell phone to order a pizza.  I figured it probably would be difficult for him to scrape around my teeth as I ate a peperoni pizza so I held back and decided to wait.  After leaving the dentist with a #1 patient sticker and no cavities, I decided it was time to have a good meal to celebrate.  Remembering that Ocean Taqueria was the home of the 14 inch burrito, the choice was easy.  I ordered the spicy chicken burrito. My burrito was good.  The beans and rice were tasty and I would give Ocean Taqueria's burrito closer to a four star if the chicken was just a little spicier and tastier.
author: Josh K.

description: Came here with my boss yesterday and was very pleased to have been introduced to a great little taqueria.  I had the baby veggie burrito and couldn't finish the whole thing so it wasn't very baby by any means.  The staff was very friendly and the food was good.  Oh, and it was cheap.  I will definitely be back.
author: Stella C.

description: I absolutely love this place!!  The food is great and you definitely get your moneys worth!  The guys are really friendly and always help me practice my Spanish while waiting for my food.... I talk and they correct me  =)
author: Kapiolani M.

description: I ate here last night, and go a few times a month. Not the best burrito spot in town, but I think this is the best one on my block. I like how they grill your chicken right there so it's nice and fresh. The dude that works there is hot too, I saw him with his shirt off once and it was nice :)
author: meagan m.

description: Great salsa selection, the 'Lada Gaga' (as in GaGaGarlic) will literally melt your face. Their burritos are large, cheap and made with quality ingredients. They also have great agua frescas.
author: Dre D.

description: Best taqueria in town! And the best bang for your buck!!! If they cleaned it up a bit it would be a 5 for sure!
author: JA R.

description: This place blows! Okay, I know that serving vegetarians is not a taqueria owner's wet dream, but the guy making our food seemed so insulted by my boyfriend and I ordering veggie burritos that he practically spit in the food.  I wanted a baby burrito and my man ordered a giant burrito but they were the same size.  Beyond the service, these were the worst burritos I have ever had, including week old guacamole.  They were little sloppy packets of sadness.
author: Tonya W.

description: The only reason there is a star is because or the way they cook their meat on the grill. It's pretty good. Not spectacular. The service here is the WORST. Very rude. Almost as if they don't want anyone to come in?? Kind of weird. It was next to Burrito Express and unfortunately they are not open as late.
author: CITY M.

description: These guys have the best burritios in the city.  That's not the reason I'm writing this.  I was in there Tues. Mar. 13 and saw this smokin' hot girl.  I didn't get her name, but we had a little conversation.  If you decided to look me up, baby, here I am!  I don't try this type of stuff very often.
author: peter k.

description: I absolutely love this place. It's run down in terms of the eating area. It is not a good place to go for a date or anything, and get your food to go.... but the food is amazing. They do not skimp out on the food. They pile the tacos and burritos up with tons of food and it's all for a GREAT price. I would definitely recommend this place.
author: nina a.

description: This place is the super fire.  Great carnitas that they put on the grill so its nice and hot which alot of places dont do.  Decent salsa not the best which is why its  four star.  Great workers they are hilarious and offer tequilla to you.  Atmosphere is like straight out of TJ except I think they are from Guatemala or somewhere not Mexico.  Overall good solid Mexican fare.
author: christian l.

description: i enjoy the burritos and the staff here. i always go for the baby burrito because it's the perfect "snack" size before i head to work. i like the options of getting green, red or regular chicken. i haven't tried their other meats, but i enjoy their boiled chicken in green sauce. the staff always talks to me in spanish which constantly reminds me that i should brush up on the language. anyway, the burrito is solid. i'm not looking for anything extraordinary or gourmet when i'm chowing down on a little donkey. prices are reasonable and i always come back. i still favor gordo's over this place... but when in pac heights, this is the stand by.
author: Erin D.

description: are people really ragging on the interior of this place? it's a freaking taqueria!!! if you want a colorful ambiance and more tables to dine at go to taco bell down the street. i've only been here once and they have the best veggie nachos i have ever had! minus two stars for it being so damn expensive.
author: Lizzy L.

description: i hate to write bad reviews but i really wasn't diggin this spot. its no suprise that its usually empty. just go down the block to burrito express.
author: Andrew D.

description: This place has the best super burritos! (Everything else looks great too, but I've never been able to not order a super burrito.) I love that they grill the chicken right in front of you when you order and throw bell peppers and onions onto the grill too if you'd like. I'll give it that the decor is not the best, but for a $7 super burrito, what do you expect?
author: KK R.

description: Good quesadillas but the service is terrible. If they mess up your order dont expect them to correct it. Though the food is ok the experience isnt recommended. I would say avoid the place and head to Tortilla Heights.
author: Morgan T.

description: i like ocean if i'm in the mood for a semi-grungy burrito. it's all about the super, veggie or not. i do love creamy burritos, especially when the guacamole and the cream are evenly distributed right alongside those refried monsters. so that's why i enjoy this little dive.
author: Faye P.

description: Man this place is not put together well, but the burritos are the best in the city! Don't let the long wait, usually 10 plus minutes, disscourage you cause it is usually worth it!
author: QuestionmarkFace S.

description: i stumbled upon this place a number of years ago after walking around my new neighborhood and still today, 6 years later is still my favorite place in SF for a burrito.
author: james b.

description: love it! been going here for years.  For the area it has the best baby burrittos at the right price.  Its not fancy, heck the menu is on a plywood, but I go in there thinking 'i just need a good burritto' and i've never been disappointed.
author: S B.

description: I've always had very good burritos here. They grill your meat when you order...and they throw the tortilla on so that it gets nice and crispy. Salsa is tasty. The chips and guac are okay...nothing special. As other reviewers mentioned...the place doesn't have the greatest ambiance but I think its worth it for the fresh burritos.
author: Melissa M.

description: The food here is soooo good! I have never had better mexican food! The people are very friendly. and very big portions for the price you pay.
author: Max H.

description: this place is good. i've never had a burrito here just some of the plates. they were very good. i was skeptical because of the decor and the hand written menu on the wall but i was happy with my food. plus considering the other mexican place on the block is so incredibly bland, you really dont have too many other options in the neighborhood.
author: A G.

description: i've spent a long time, years probably, pondering what/where the best burrito is.  hands down, the best is at ocean.  i can honestly say that this is the yummiest burrito i've ever tasted.  i crave it like candy.  it's made to order, fresh, delicious, and huge.  the marinade they put on their grilled chicken is amazing.  the staff is awesome too, they always say "see you manana?" and they usually will.
author: alexis w.
